campaign.story:
NOTE ABOUT CURRENCY:
As we are based in Sydney; Australia, the project goal and all pricing is given in Australian dollars (AUD). We have included an approximate USD conversion for all the reward tiers and add-ons. The project goal of $12,000 AUD is approximately $9,000 USD.
Medieval Playing Cards is the original deck created by Egor Klyuchnyk from Anomaly world studio in collaboration with Elephant Playing cards.
Inspired by fearless knights, severe lords and gorgeous queens, Medieval is a fully custom hand-drawn deck with one way courts in the original old style of playing card decks. From the card stock to the construction of the tuckbox, Medieval is designed to transport you back in time with a contemporary twist!
Silver and Gold edition decks with Foil (to be unlocked!)
   These new decks have been created to show all beauty of the Medieval Age and inspired by the great artist - Diego Velásquez. Through this deck we want you to feel this epoch, and experience its elegance and grandeur. We present two types of decks: First, the Silver Unlimited Edition, and second the Gold Limited Edition for those who want to stand out.
Unlimited SILVER Edition
   Limited GOLD Edition
 Features of the decks:
Printed by Legends Playing Cards Company.
Thicker Robusto card stock for a genuine medieval feel.
Red wax-style seal.
Intricate custom numbered seal on the Limited Gold deck (if unlocked)
Authentic out-of-the box tuck flap packaging.
Beautiful and Intricate 2-way back design for both decks.
Unique coat of arms for each suit- subtle background design. 
Card Backs (click for higher resolution)
  Note about the out-of-the-box tuck flap
Several people have commented how impractical this will be for continual use - this is not the case! Once the seal is broken and the deck opened, the flap will fold back inside the tuckbox just like a normal deck. It is the same size and will function exactly the same as a normal deck after opening. We have chosen to use this construction method to emulate old-style decks, but with the ability to convert back if you want to. It is unique and looks awesome, but once you open it it will work just like another (but better) deck of cards!
    Medieval playing cards were created with one way faces harking back to the old style playing cards to represent nobility in all their glory. Make sure to click on the pictures for a higher resolution image - you will be amazed at the intricacy and detail in each picture!
  Spades - Courts (click for higher resolution)
                  Spades - Number Cards
    Hearts - Courts (click for higher resolution)
                 Hearts - Number Cards
     Clubs - Courts (click for higher resolution)
                 Clubs - Number Cards
    Diamonds - Courts (click for higher resolution)
                 Diamonds - Number Cards
  Silver Edition Jokers (click for higher resolution)
    The limited edition deck will unlock at AU$20,000 ($15k USD). It is a full-color version of the unlimited Silver edition deck with heaps of character:
Limited GOLD Edition Courts (click for higher resolution)
  Limited GOLD Edition Faces (click for higher resolution)
            Medieval: Gold Edition is limited to 1000 units ONLY. You can only get one by pledging for the specific reward tiers.
The Uncut sheet has been custom-designed to best showcase these beautiful designs. Add on onto your pledge using the table below:
Both editions of uncut sheet are available If the Gold edition is unlocked. You will specify which edition you want in the survey are the end of the project.
If you want to add more than one Uncut sheet to your pledge, send me a message first for a reduced price as you only have to pay for shipping once!
    Silver Edition Back and Seal
  What project is complete without some tantalizing stretch goals to make it interesting?
$12,000 - FUNDED! Thank you!
$20,000 - Limited GOLD Edition Unlocked
$25,000 -  Intricately designed Numbered seal to all Gold edition decks.
$30,000 - Foil to all deck tuckboxes (Silver foil to Silver deck, Gold foil to Gold deck)
  Medieval Campaign: July - August 2016
Digital Proofs: August 2016
Physical Proofs: September - October 2016
Printing Finish: November 2016
Decks arrive at Warehouse: December 2016
Fulfillment Complete: December 2016

Anomaly World on Instagram
Elephant Playing Cards on Facebook
Elephant Playing Cards on Twitter
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have done a lot of research and reviewed several companies to ensure that this project goes as smoothly as possible. In the end, the proven quality and experience of Legends Playing Card Company (LPCC) was a major factor in the decision to produce with them. We have set the delivery date conservatively so as not to rush the production of the product, and have full confidence in LPCC to produce the decks, and Gamblers Warehouse to fulfill them.

Elephant Playing Cards have launched several previous campaigns, and while they were completed relatively smoothly, there may be unanticipated problems which could arise. We have thoroughly prepared for this campaign and will be open and transparent to all backers if any difficulties are encountered. The designs are 100% finished so there should be no delay in sending the digital proofs to the manufacturer, and then onto production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Just letting you know that Elephant Playing Cards has relaunched on Kickstarter!

Hi Everyone,
I wanted to drop you a quick message to let you know that our latest collaboration with Anomaly World Studios (the same guys who designed Medieval Cards), is now LIVE on Kickstarter!

Hi Everyone,
I just wanted to let you know that our current project: Pipmen World, only has 1 day left! almost 900 backers and $46k can't be wrong - you don't want to miss this deck!

Hi Everyone,
I just wanted to drop a quick line to let you know that our newest project - Pipmen: World is over 150% funded with heaps of backers. It is a world-first deck of cards featuring both semi-transformational designs and a global puzzle element making it absolutely unique. You will not find a deck like this anywhere!

Hi Everyone!
I am so excited to announce that my newest deck - Pipmen: World, is now LIVE on Kickstarter! I have been working on this deck for almost 3 years now - everything I have done has been building up to this and I am can't wait to see this made!

Hi Everyone,
Just a quick line to let you know that fulfillment for this project has been completed a few weeks ago. Most of the US backers should have received their rewards, international may take a bit longer.
I hope you all really like the decks - I think they turned out really well :)
3 more things:

Hi everyone,
Just touching base to let you know that I have received confirmation that all the decks have been shipped from the warehouse, so you will get them soon. If you are in the US, experience tells me you will have them in 2-10 days. If you are international, then anywhere from 4-20 days. If you are waiting longer than 3 weeks, make sure to get in touch with me to sort out what has happened. Some people leave it for months and months – just let me know and I’ll do my best to track it down or replace.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy new year! (and finish your surveys!)
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just a quick update to let you know that the Medieval decks are now onboard our delivery plane headed to our warehouse. the ETA is the 10th of Jan, so all going well we should begin shipping in around a week.
This means I need your surveys returned! Most people have been great and filled them out already, but I can't ship you anything if I don't know where you live! If you haven't filled out your survey then fill it out! (if you haven't you will have been getting periodic reminder emails from me).

Hi everyone,
Just wanted to drop a quick line to let you know that I have recieved confirmation from Legends that the Medieval decks are printed, packaged up, and ready for transport. They are currently waiting on a quotation for air transport (which will take ~1 week travel time instead of 4), and then they will be off. I expect that this project will start fulfilling in around 2 weeks.

Hi everyone!
Just a quick update to let you know the status of these awesome Medieval playing cards:
Printing of decks and cards complete.
The decks are currently being packaged to be shipped.
They will be shipped by air mail, so aprox. 1 week travel time.
Once the decks arrive at our warehouse they will be shipped.

campaign.story:
"CALAVERAS DE AZÚCAR " is a custom deck of playing cards inspired by the Day of the Dead Celebration. Printed by USPCC.
Calaveras are the most recognizable emblems of the Day of the Dead – Mexican holiday, celebrated on the 1st and 2nd November.
    The word “Calavera” means skull in Spanish. “Calavera De Azúcar” is a skull made out of sugar, which is used to decorate Day of the Dead altars. These sugar skulls are very colorful and whimsical, not scary at all. I absolutely love the Sugar Skull style used for the Day of the Dead.
In terms of meaning, the skull symbolizes death but in a positive manner. In Mexico it is believed that death is not the final stage in one’s life but rather a step forward into a higher level of conscience.
CALAVERAS DE AZÚCAR Playing Cards - Black - Printed by the USPCC 
   Limited run of 2500 decks
  One thing that makes sugar skulls stand out from other skull-related creations is how jolly it looks. Most depictions of the skull are either creepy or morbid, but sugar skulls are happy and cheerful ones. The reason for this is because they want to capture the joy and spirit of their deceased loved ones.
The symbolism of a sugar skull is rooted in the decoration around the eyes. Flowers are meant to symbolize life, while cobwebs symbolize death. The skulls are designed to be bright and cheerful, being a celebration of the life that once was.

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
My NEW "CHRISTMAS" Deck 2017 is now available for PRE-ORDER at www.nataliasilva.net!
Christmas is definitely my favorite holiday! It's The Most Wonderful Time Of The Year!!!

Dear Backers,
I would like to invite you to join my latest and the the most BEAUTIFUL campaign ever -"AVALON" Playing Cards. I put a lot of love, effort and time into each card.
"AVALON" is a custom deck of playing card inspired by the legend of King Arthur. It combines elegance, class and exceptional details, with the highest quality materials.
Avalon, the legendary island from old Celtic mythology ("the isle of fruit or apple trees"), is was a fables utopian paradise where the legends of English knights and political equality unite in a kingdom lost in the mists of time.

Dear Backers,
"CRAZY" deck is finally here!!!! Let's throw all the rules out the window and get CRAZY!
"CRAZY" deck is so crazy it's nuts! Take sometime to look closely as some of the funny characters and items in the design. Let me know how crazy you think CRAZY DECK REALLY IS!!

Dear Backers,
"MUERTOS" ANIMALS Edition Playing Cards are now LIVE on the Kickstarter!!!
We have some awesome standard and Limited Edition decks + if you missed my original "MUERTOS" campaign (with human skulls) - they are available as add-ons!!!
All the Limited Edition decks are Kickstarter exclusive!!!

Dear Backers,
I would like to invite you to join my new project -"MUERTOS" ANIMALS Edition Playing Cards.
"MUERTOS" ANIMALS Edition is a second part of my "MUERTOS" Playing Cards COLLECTION! Printed by USPCC.

Dear Backers,
I would like to invite you to join my latest project -"MUERTOS" Playing Cards. 
"MUERTOS" is a custom deck of playing cards inspired by the Day of the Dead Celebration. Printed by USPCC.

campaign.story:
The Moirai , also known as the Fates, are white-robed incarnations of destiny. Three sisters who control the mother thread of life of every mortal from birth to death. They direct fate – ensuring the fate assigned to every being by eternal laws takes its course without obstruction.
Take fate into your own hands by backing this beautifully custom designed and illustrated playing card deck.
The tuck case cover depicts the two-headed eagle - symbolic for the powerful empires that shape the world - but still have no control over the fates. The back of the tuck case shows the art that is also the card back - a twisting mass of vines - alive and dead. The case will be printed in black and white with a spot varnish. The die-cut seal sticker has the initials of the three sisters - Nona, Morta, & Decima.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've successfully produced and fulfilled another playing card deck (under a different account). The campaign was named Fanagled (https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tunnelbravo/fanangled-card-deck-v-20-uspcc?ref=nav_search. I switched accounts because the first one belonged to my last company which was closed in 2014. The biggest challenge – as I learned from the other two campaigns is fulfillment. Getting product out to all the backers in a timely manner - especially the international backers - since their shipments require more time due to the additional paper work. With my past experience I know I can handle it - but it's still a challenge none-the-less.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Memento mori (Latin: "remember (that you have) to die") is the medieval Latin theory and practice of reflection on mortality, especially as a means of considering the vanity of earthly life and the transient nature of all earthly goods and pursuits. It is related to the ars moriendi ("The Art of Dying") and related literature.
Memento mori has been an important part of ascetic disciplines as a means of perfecting the character, by cultivating detachment and other virtues, and turning the attention towards the immortality of the soul and the afterlife. 
In art, memento mori are artistic or symbolic reminders of mortality.
In the European Christian art context, "the expression... developed with the growth of Christianity, which emphasized Heaven, Hell, and salvation of the soul in the afterlife."
Life is short, and shortly it will end;
Death comes quickly and respects no one,
Death destroys everything and takes pity on no one.
To death we are hastening, let us refrain from sinning.
If you do not turn back and become like a child,
And change your life for the better,
You will not be able to enter, blessed, the Kingdom of God.
To death we are hastening, let us refrain from sinning.
http://www.maxplayingcards.com/en/2016/04/21/memento-mori-collection-carpe-diem-and-vanitas-playing-cards-it-is-inevitable-you-like-them/
Review by Kardify : http://www.kardify.com/2016/04/kickstarter-carpe-diem-and-vanitas.html
Carpe diem is usually translated "seize the day". The expression "memento mori" ("remember that you are mortal") carries some of the same connotation as "carpe diem". Mindfulness of our own mortality is key in making us realize the importance of the moment. "Remember that you are mortal, so seize the day."
Memento Mori Collection Carpe Diem playing cards deck created in black and white colors. It include 2 extra cards (revealed later), unique for this edition. Tuck box has embossing and custom seal.
Carpe Diem tuck interrior printed in silver
The Triumph of Death Print by Philip Galle ca 1565. 
Vanitas means "emptiness" and refers to the view of earthly life and the worthless nature of all earthly goods and pursuits. The word vanitas derives its prominence from the Ecclesiastes, and in Vulgate the verse is rendered as "Vanitas vanitatum omnia vanitas".
Memento Mori Collection Vanitas playing cards deck is more artistic, with antique-look, ground color scheme. Features Memento and Vanitas bonus cards. Tuck box has embossing and custom seal.
Vanitas tuck interrior printed in copper
Memento mori: a corpse, all skin and bones, lying in a landscape, a scythe in his hand; around him, putti playing music and singing, and monkeys chained up to a ball. Anonymous French woodcut dated c.1580.
CARPE DIEM deck seal
VANITAS deck seal
Please check update #2 and #3 for more details
Please check update #3 for more details

As it is not our first Kickstarter project, all possible risks were taken highly serious. We have done a lot of research to ensure that this project goes smoothly. campaign.story:
Don Quixote Vol. 1 Playing Cards illustrates the eccentric and memorable characters of the novel to share with the whole world. It's also an homage to the creation of Spanish novelist Cervantes on the 400th anniversary of his death this month of April.
This Vol. 1 playing card deck is based on the first volume of the Don Quixote novel and it's unique characters. In all, it will be a series of two volumes and this deck will be the first part of it.
Every part of this deck has been custom-illustrated from scratch by our design studio, Cellar Window. Each court cards represents a central character in the first volume of the Don Quixote novel. We have designed it carefully and researched books as well as old etchings of the characters to create something unique. 
The Don and Hidalgo decks
Don Quixote Vol. 1 shares a glimpse of the beautiful characters within the novel written by Miguel Cervantes with the whole world. Custom-Illustrations on these playing cards will allow you to revisit the beloved characters that the Hidalgo Don Quixote meets during his first travels as a knight-errant throughout Spain.
You will find characters illustrated in great detail that befits a novel who stood the test of time. 
Gold foiling with a perforated tuck seal
The card backs features Sancho and the Don
Don Quixote Vol. 1 will have a limited print run by LPCC (Legends Playing Card Company) on traditionally cut European card stock and Emerald Finish, making cards that has a great snap and feel to it. If you have ever handled some of the premium decks from Lawrence at LPCC you will know first hand that their status as one of the top in the playing card manufacturing world is self evident.
Features:  
Printed and Fulfilled by the Legends Playing Card Company 
 Custom Courts, Aces, Jokers and Pip Layout 
Traditionally Cut European Card Stock with Emerald Finish 
Premium Matte Card Stock Box 
Custom Perforated Tax Stamp Seal
Gold Foiling
 Don Quixote Vol.1 - Hidalgo Deck
Hidalgo Deck is now available for all Backers! Backers that pledged for two or more decks will then be able to have the choice of receiving both decks in their pledge. Making mixed Bricks or Pairs possible.
Please also share this project to your friends with this link! http://kck.st/22Lya86
You guys are the ones that can help make this project a reality and into your hands, so the more people who see, like and back this project, the quicker we are able reach our goal and unlock more cool stuff. Sharing this project on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to your friends is a huge help and is greatly appreciated, thank you so much for being a part of Don Quixote!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our second project after Fuego. Our first project was very successful but not without a few setbacks. Having said that, we have learned a lot on what can be done to keep risks at a minimum.

All the designs are finished and set for printing by Legends Playing Cards and they will be handling the manufacturing and fulfillment of the decks. Although there will always be risks to every project we've made an enormous effort to streamline everything and to minimize the challenges for this deck. 

And with their amazing track record, we are confident that Legends Playing Cards will do an awesome job with regards to the Printing and Fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The playing cards for cardists, collectors, magicians, card players, artists, enthusiasts and everyone in between. Designer playing cards with attitude.
Remember us?
The Buzz:
In April 2015, over 500 people from all over the world contributed to the Kickstarting of the Joker and the Thief Playing Card Company. We released our debut deck - a completely custom, foil-covered deck of playing cards that oozed attitude. The design that you helped create was a hit, and is now loved by people around the world, all thanks to you! 
We're extremely proud of the original deck and its general reception. It won a place on Kardify's Top 12 Decks of 2015! We were interviewed by ABC Local Radio Australia and the Local Newspaper. The original deck recently won third place in United Cardists' "2015: Deck of the Year Contest" for three categories - Best Ace of Spaces, Best Jokers and Best Tuck Box. The deck also landed a spot within the Top 100 Hot New Releases in Toys and Games on Amazon, as well as being featured on Art of Play, Cardvolution, and Gambler's Warehouse - three of the biggest playing card retailers on the planet. 
We’ve been absent for a while, but now we’re back! The Joker and the Thief return with a striking and luxurious colour way – White and Gold.
Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition 
Sharp. Streamline. Sublime
Tuck box photography by our friend Fabien Defaucheux. Check out his work on Instagram - @Fabiendefaucheux
 In collaboration with our artist Pedro Oyarbide, we originally sought to create a deck that was distinctly unique amongst other decks of playing cards on the market. We focussed on 100% custom illustration, striking details, eye-catching packaging and deep connotation evident through symbolic design. 
To add to the mythology that the Joker and the Thief Playing Cards evoke, we decided to create a white and gold edition. This creates a third dimension of meaning, contrasting the darkness of the original deck with the light colour scheme of the second edition. This builds upon the conflict between life and mortality that is apparent on the back design. The Joker and the Thief emerge from the shadows more beautiful than ever.
The Back Design
Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition rocks a metallic gold, inverted colour scheme.
A thought provoking dynamic of mysticism and myth.
The first step in creating the original cards was to create a unique back design. One that not only had an intricately beautiful design but one that both appealed aesthetically and sentimentally. It had to be thought provoking. From the first sketches to the end product, it slowly developed its own flair, and this continues throughout the deck! 
The back design is one way; it is perhaps one of, if not, the most unobtrusive and functional major one-way design on a deck of cards.
This allows for a unique story and symbolism to be evoked; metaphors of life and mortality, thievery, lies, deceit, power, mysticism, struggle, and love. We see the opposition of the King and Joker, the way they oppose each other, each being attacked by a viper, a symbol that despite their contrast, both share the same fate. The chained hands, both of flesh and bone, represent mortality. They hold cards; life holds the ace of spades, the death card, and the skeletal holds a card with a skull on it, representing the inevitability of death. The chains and manacles link the Joker and the Thief, and the daggers represent the danger of their opposition.
The Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition features an inverted back design sporting bright gold metallic ink for gorgeous shimmer in sunlight. 
The Ace of Spades 
Iconic. Draped in Gold.
A bold statement. The ace of spades is the source of the original deck's identity.
Joker and the Thief's debut Ace of Spades returns
The Court Cards
12 Completely Custom Court Cards
The court cards are all completely custom, illustrated from scratch. The themes that you see on the back design can be seen here. You may even start to see a story forming as you shuffle through them. We have created something different. We have done away with borders to free the courts - to make use of the space and to make each of them distinct and prominent characters.
"12 court cards, dressed with charisma and distinct in character - royalty ready for battle." - Art of Play
The Joker and The Thief 
The Two Troublemakers Return. 
The Joker and The Thief
The Tuck Box 
Peppered with Lavish Touches.
By far the most praised aspect of the original deck of Joker and the Thief Playing Cards was the tuck box, which was adorned with a heavy amount of silver foil hot stamped on both the exterior and interior of the box. Now we have dressed the second edition in a beautiful white and gold colour scheme. 
With gold foil stamping, embossing, a perforated blood red tax stamp seal now featuring gold foil, and a new uncoated matte finish for the white stock - this version is bound to stand out amongst your collection. Impress your friends with a deck that many are calling a conversation starter!
This tuck case will look amazing on your poker nights, pulling them out to perform to a spectator, residing on a shelf amonst your prized collection, or featured in an opening shot of one of your Cardistry Videos. 
Beautiful and extravagant tuck boxes are going to be a consistent feature of the Joker and the Thief brand moving into the future.
Interior Hot Foil Stamping
Designed with Handling in Mind
Lightened and Improved. Taking full advantage of design and composition.
As a more refined version of the original deck, the White Gold edition had to be lightened, and stripped back. By inverting the back design, it not only created an elegant aesthetic, but it also significantly cuts the amount of ink saturation within the card stock. This takes full advantage of the composition of Classic Finish. By stripping back a significant amount of Joker and the Thief’s ink, this deck should possess a far snappier; far more responsive and papery feel in comparison to the original deck. 
The Bells and Whistles 
All the features you want, know and love!
Thinner Borders
100% Custom Pips, Fonts, Court Cards and Art Work
Updated Colour Scheme
Gold and Silver Metallic Inks (Faces and Backs)
Interior Tuck Case Gold Foil Stamping 
Exterior Tuck Case Embossing + Hot Stamped Gold Foil Coverage
Dramatic Ink Saturation Reduction 
CLASSIC Stock and Finish for Improved Handling
Matte Finish Tuck Case Paper
Traditionally Cut for Smooth Edges
Perforated Blood Red Tax Stamp Style Seal now with Gold Foil
Manufacturing
The Expert Playing Card Company will manufacture the second edition of Joker and the Thief Playing Cards. This ensures that you receive the highest quality product possible, and a deck of playing cards that is both incredibly durable and handles amazingly. 
Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition will sport the highly acclaimed CLASSIC Stock and Finish. To take full advantage of this type of stock and finish, this edition will feature a reduction of ink saturation due to its inverted back design. This, along with being traditionally cut, ensures snappier, smoother, crisper and more responsive cards for maximised performance.
This praised finish has both the snappiness and durability of EPCC's previous decks combined with the more papery feel and slick finish of a traditional USPCC deck. It is the best of both worlds.
LEFT: Standard USPCC Cutting. RIGHT: Precision Cutting (Our Manufacturer) EPCC
Fulfilment Service
To ensure that your decks arrive safely and quickly, Art of Play will be returning to fulfil the Joker and the Thief: Gold Edition deck. We were extremely impressed by the quality of Art of Play's services during our last Kickstarter campaign. Each deck was sent out securely and quickly, with no delay and no mistakes. As one of the most trusted brands in the industry it is an easy choice for us to turn yet again to Art of Play.
If you are not familiar with Art of Play, they are the sister company to Dan and Dave Industries and have distributed pledges for campaigns such as Fontaine Cards, Saturns by Franky Morales, Mirage by Patrick Kun and many others. 
Because Art of Play is handling the distribution of your playing cards:
You have peace of mind that your decks will arrive safe and sound
No Shipping Errors
Art of Play ship globally
You receive a tracking number sent directly to your email address
Take advantage of Free Shipping options within the USA
Now with even FASTER shipping worldwide on bulk decks with FedEx!
*Please note that Art of Play are based in San Diego, USA.*
Who We Are
James Milaras - Co-Founder and Owner
Firstly, I'd like to thank you for visiting the campaign page for our second project. My name is James Milaras, and I am the co-founder and owner of the Joker and the Thief Playing Card Company. 
Secondly, we're very thankful here at Joker and the Thief for you guys, our backers! Last year, you made something very special happen. My best friend and business partner, Reuben, and I wanted to create a special deck of playing cards. Creating a deck of cards was our dream ever since we first got into cards. Our backers made that a reality! You will always be apart of team Joker and the Thief.
Reuben Nutt, while still collaborating with us has since moved town to pursue other interests. His continued efforts in creating beautiful video and photographic content for Joker and the Thief has been outstanding. Of course a shout out to our beast of an illustrative team member, Pedro Oyarbide, for his amazing work on this project as well as an upcoming monster of a project.
With that said there is even more cool stuff from us this year! Joker and the Thief: Dystopia is coming (*winks*). If you don't know who we are, here's a little something that will bring you up to speed with us!
Joker and the Thief was founded by two Australian Cardists, videographers and photographers that have huge love for all things playing cards.
Back in 2012, we started up a YouTube channel called Joker and the Thief Card Deck Reviews. Through this we collaborated with Art of Play. We got together on our weekends, and in our spare time to go out and location scout to shoot. We then edited in house, usually side by side, listening to music and fuelled by snacks. We had minimal equipment and a very small budget (if there really was one) Oh the joys of indie film making!
We sought to change the way deck reviews were made and in doing so, many adventures were had along the way. Since we didn't have a car at the time, our bikes and our legs were the main source of transport in our city, if we were to shoot on location. With little time, little transport, a budget of... not much, and our favourite Youtubers, Film Makers, and Cardists as our inspiration, we slowly but surely developed our skills. We had some truly memorable moments along the way. We always knew that we were going to create a deck of cards... one day. And here we are - Round 2! 
We've done this once guys! We can do it again. Let's smash 100%! Pledge today.
Testimonials and Ambassadors
Extra Rewards!
Yay!
Uncut Sheets
Uncut Sheets. Extremely limited. A perfect collector's item and rare piece of art to frame and hang on your wall. Oh, and it comes with a FREE DECK of Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition Playing Cards.
Measures 22 inches by 26.5 inches. Ready for Framing.
Measures 22 inches by 26.5 inches. Ready for Framing.
Posters 
Photographic Poster of the Original Joker and the Thief Playing Cards. A3. Gloss Finish. Signed, and numbered. Ready for Framing. 
This Campaign
The aim of this campaign is to keep everything as simple as possible. We want to create a seamless process that is uncomplicated so that we can eliminate as much confusion as possible.
Since we are based in Australia, the campaign is funded in AUD (Australian Dollars). In each pledge option we have supplied a conversion to $USD for your convenience.
This campaign is for the Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition Playing Cards, with an aim to produce a limited run of 3000 decks. We're not creating stretch goals and combos. We're keeping this campaign simple and transparent. We like being on the same page as you!
If you'd like to back more decks or other rewards with your decks we have a simple add-on guide for you to follow! Its straight forward and easy to use. 
The more decks you back, the cheaper they become. 
We are offering 100 individual decks for all you early birds out there and other limited rewards.
If you have any questions please don't hesitate to message us or consult our FAQ section at the bottom of this page.
**If you are a wholesaler and would like to inquire about stock for your store, send us a message here on Kickstarter or send an email to Jokerandthethief1@gmail.com. This time we have also supplied a pledge option for wholesalers for your convenience. 
Add Ons!
Here's a guide on what to do if you have one pledge option such as an uncut sheet but want to get more decks!
Add-Ons Guide
Want an uncut sheet or a poster, or have a single deck and want more decks? Follow our add-on guide - please make sure that you shoot us a message specifying exactly what you would like then go ahead and adjust your pledge with the according shipping price included on a list below. 
-
Example: U.S. Backer wants to add 6 more Decks of Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition Playing Cards to their current pledge.
Current Pledge: $20AUD ($15USD) - 1 Deck of Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition Playing Cards 
ADD: $99AUD ($75 USD) (6 Decks) + $13AUD (6 Decks Dom. Shipping total) to current pledge for a total of 7 Decks at $120 AUD.
Example: International Backer wants to add 6 more decks of Joker and the Thief Playing Cards to their current pledge.
Current Pledge: $20AUD ($15USD) - 1 Deck of Joker and the Thief: White Gold Edition Playing Cards
ADD: $99AUD ($75 USD) (6 Decks) + $34AUD (6 Decks Int. Shipping total) to current pledge for a total of 7 Decks at $141AUD.
Just add these shipping prices to the price of your preferred pledge option and you're on your way! We hope that clears things up for you guys!
Get in Touch with Us!
We'd love to connect with you!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Now that we have launched a Kickstarter campaign successfully, we now don't have to worry about inexperience. We are confident that this Kickstarter campaign will be an even smoother process than our last project. 

As with any project, there are risks and challenges involved. We ensure that our methods are simple. Outsourcing will once again allow for a very smooth and successful campaign.

Shipping:

- We are enlisting Art of Play to handle the shipping of your decks. So as soon as the Expert Playing Card Company has finished manufacturing the cards, the stock will then be sent to Art of Play's warehouse in San Diego, California. The shipping of the stock to Art of Play may take up to three weeks. There is a possibility that this process may be slightly delayed, but in case that this happens, you will be updated.

- Your orders will promptly be packed and sent out to wherever you are in the world. If you have ever received a package from Art of Play, you will know that their packages are secure and every deck arrives in immaculate condition. You will also receive a tracking number for your rewards!

- We expect the cards to be shipping out to you in [Insert Date]. If earlier you'll be updated. We'd rather over-promise than under-deliver.

Production:

- As it stands, the files have been at EPCC prior to the launch of this campaign. So, as soon as we hit our goal, we will give Expert the all clear to start production.

- When the campaign is successful and has concluded half the job will be done. It may take 3-4 weeks for manufacturing time. There is always a possibility that a delay or a problem can occur in terms of manufacturing. Expert Playing Card Company has an excellent work ethic and will work hard to ensure that no issues come up, and if they do, will be sorted quickly.

- It is important to note that we also receive physical and digital proofs from Expert that must be approved. Since we are based in Australia allow for up to 2 weeks for us to receive these proofs and confirm them. We need to make sure that you are guaranteed quality. 

Updates:

- As soon as we hear something, you will too. Our updates section will be our platform to announce anything new to you.

Other Rewards:

- For those who pledge for posters, they will be produced, signed, packaged and shipped in house. We will make sure that your posters are sent out as early as possible.

Thanks very much for visiting our campaign page and backing! Let's do this!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Finally, check out this quick preview recorded at the Nürnberg Toy Fair:
Although still a prototype, In the Name of Odin already makes a quite good impression. The game plays pretty fast and there is a lot going on. Read the full review by Ralf Toggler on www.boardgame.de.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
NSKN Games has been publishing quality board games since 2011. We have published 10 titles so far, with 4 of them - Progress: Evolution of Technology, Exodus: Edge of Extinction, Mistfall and Simurgh - financed through Kickstarter.

Our delivery track record is so far impeccable, each project was finalized and delivered before or by the deadline, in spite of tight self-imposed schedules. Simurgh, funded in December 2015 is due to be delivered in May 2015, right on schedule. However, we are aware that each project has its own specific challenges and we plan to reduce the risk through careful planning and contingency measures.

With four successful projects we are making use of our experiences to improve our processes and further decrease any risks. As In the Name of Odin is our fifth Kickstarter campaign, we already know the ropes, and with the time used to prepare not only the game, but also the campaign itself, we are ready to face any possible challenges.

Our goal with In the Name of Odin is to produce the game within 90 days from the campaign end, and to deliver before the end of August 2016. We already have a detailed production and shipping plan in place.

The new challenge with In the Name of Odin is the presence of plastic miniatures. This is a new technology with which we have some degree of experience (Exodus had plastic miniatures) but we have enrolled the help of experts in this field.

The fulfillment will be handled by the same companies that helped us deliver Progress, Exodus and Mistfall. We're already familiar with their systems and vice-versa, thus we expect little to no delays on this front.

Although In the Name of Odin is fully developed and the artwork is 75% ready, we are also prepared for unexpected delays. In the worst case scenario, finalizing the art could add delays of max. 10 days, production of some extra 25 days and shipping & customs may add 10-15 days.

We are experienced at dealing with large production runs, and we are preparing backup plans for each step of our project, starting from production, through shipping, to final delivery.

With all of the above points in mind, we estimate that there is a 80% chance of a delivery at or before the deadline and only a 20% chance of a 30 days delay.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS

Because we are dealing with a large number of games produced, packed and shipped, there is always a chance for human error or damaged parts. If such a thing happens, please check out our customer support page on www.nskn.net and we will send you replacements with all due haste. We are consolidating all requests and shipping replacements on Mondays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Ladies and Gentlemen!
The NSKN Games Team is proud to present Paladin Card Protection: a line of premium sleeves for a wide variety of games, now live on Kickstarter!

Ladies & Gentlemen,
10 days from now Spiel 2016 will open its gates and we will be there, waiting for your visit.
For those of you who have selected the pledge level with Essen pick-up we have prepared brief instructions on how to pick up your games:
go to hall 1, booth G-124, where you should easily recognize NSKN Games booth,
look for a poster saying Essen pick-up,
provide your backer id or your backer email and we will give you your reward;

Ladies and Gentlemen!
Wwith the delivery of In the Name of Odin slowly concluding, I would like to bring you a bit of information on our involvement in one of the biggest events in gaming: Essen Spiel 2016.

updates.update_userinfo: Post Gen Con update mostly about USA and Canada shipping
updates.update_content:
Ladies & Gentlemen,
Our team has just returned from Gen Con and got a little bit of rest - flying to the East is no joy when it comes to jet lag and adapting back to home time zone - but we're now at work full speed ahead and the first thing we took care of is an update on fulfillment.
1. Canada

Ladies & Gentlemen,
We are happy to let you know that many packages have already been sent out from our fulfillment places in UK and Poland as follows:
Australia & New Zealand
Europe
Asia

Ladies & Gentlemen,
Your wait is almost over.
Both vessels carrying boxes of In the Name of Odin have reach destination ports and road shipments are on the way in Europe while in US the games are still in customs.
You can see below a detailed plan for shipping individual game boxes to... You!

updates.update_userinfo: Last chance to update your survey and fulfillment plan
updates.update_content:
Ladies & Gentlemen,
The vessels carrying In the Name of Odin are making their final approach to port and by mid-July they should both reach their destinations ports. From there shipments will be split to fulfillment centers, thus we need to ask you to check your survey and make the necessary changes.
This is the last moment you can update your address, so please update it if you moved in the last 2-3 months.

updates.update_userinfo: Tracking vessels to US and EU
updates.update_content:
Ladies & Gentlemen,
As some of you have asked to provide tracking option for vessels carring containers with game boxes, we are sharing now this information with you.
1. EU
Vessel / voyage: MATZ MAERSK / 623W

Ladies & Gents,
Another quick update... both containers (to North America and Europe) have left port and are on the way. From now we can start counting roughly 30 days until they reach destination ports (if the weather is fine) and some more for customs clearance.
We will of course keep you posted.

Ladies & Gentlemen,
As we speak, in front of a warehouse in Shanghai, China, there are two containers being loaded with lots and lots of In the Name of Odin boxes. 
The next step is to clear export customs on the Chinese side. There's a lot of paperwork involved, so our conservative estimation is that by 12-Jun this step will be completed. Then containers will be loaded on vessels and wait for departure, scheduled on 18-Jun.

@BGR: You might want to watch Rahdo's runthrough to get a better idea for how the game plays. Essentially, however, there is an immense variability stemming from the various raids, heroes, and cards. Each game is going to be completely different. Each time, you will have a new puzzle to solve, and have to figure out how to most efficiently outrace your opponents to the finish line. Deciding which hero to recruit, which ship to acquire, and which raids to pursue are just some of the decisions you have to make. When should you build a building, and in which order? The way those additional requirements are swapped is purely mechanical, the idea being that you want them to change constantly. In fact, a crafty player can use this to make life difficult for another player who has just prepared for a raid last turn. It seems he has everything he needs, but then the requirement changes slightly because you just completed a raid, and the token is swapped :)

Theme wise I can understand why it may seem like their is a disconnect. However, look at it this way — when you go on raid X, you're not merely going to /location/ X ... you're going on an X /type/ of raid. Depending on the zone, there are different things to consider: the length of the journey, the seas, potential resistance in the area, etc. Instead of having 10+ locations for "far away raids", there's simply zone 3, with 3 possible viking tokens. To the vikings left in the village, you merely sailed far away. It doesn't matter if that took you to the British isles or to Iceland. Traveling to the British Isles you would need another warrior. Traveling to Iceland you would need another sailor.
Hope this makes sense.

Thor Heyerdahl has really helped us better understand and make sense of the viking travels outside of Scandinavia and Europe.

Of course, the norsemen influenced much of what we now know as the european identity, having had a great impact on the early to mid middle ages. The national parliament of Iceland is still called the same as it was more than a 1000 years ago - the althing. Tolkien and other authors after him, have brought elements of norse culture into fantasy, and that has bled over into popculture, allowing shows like Vikings or The Last Kingdom to be made :) The cultural influence and significance of Vikings is still very strong, even though it's been almost a 1000 years since the final successful invasion of the British Isles :)

• Gold resource (or simply a way to earn Fame points). Sometimes you may have recruited more vikings than you need (either because of the cards you had, or because someone was able to go on a raid you were aiming for). Being able to give up unusable vikings for a small amount of fame points or gold (which would need some use in the game) could perhaps work.

No concrete ideas for how that would work, but it could be interesting. Maybe even just a single event card ... a "storm" ... which is added to one of the raid slots on the board. The storm increases the cost of the raid by 1 sailor, but with no benefit. There would be ways for the storm to move from one slot to another. A small expansion sounds great. Could You use the backside of the board for the extended play?
@Rainer: Ooh yeah it would :)
@Dan: Something like that (donate a viking to help someone on their quest) would fit well with the saga idea as well.

@Krzysztof: Awesome! Glad to hear you like the idea! I would definitely like seeing something like that. A small expansion that players can choose to add (or not, as they desire) I think would work really well.

While we're throwing random ideas out, I'm keen on the idea of a little more player interaction... How about being able to offer help to other players' raids - give a warrior/trader/sailor to their cause in return for a share of the fame? Maybe some buildings would give additional bonuses to players who help or are helped.
@Krzysztof Zięba The really big raids at that time would have been Londinium, Lutetia Parisiorum (Paris), Rome and Konstantinoupolis, im guessing that would be a huge raid and saga in the making
@Krzysztof Zięba @LudiBooster Thanks for the answers

@Rainer - that's an awesome idea! Provided In the Name of Odin has some fans interested in it, I'd be super interested in sitting down to create a small expansion in the vein of Mistfall's Valskyrr. And that idea - a different kind of Raid to spice things up a bit - is really cool :)
Sagas (or legends) would potentially be more challenging than raids, but would not require any distance to travel. In fact, completing various raids could be prerequisite to complete a saga.

Also, at least in Michael's video, one mistake he made with the rules made the game last a few turns less - he kept his Heroes after a raid a couple of times, but they should be discarded after taking part in a raid. While five buildings are a rarity in the game (that's a lot of Craftsmanship symbols!), three to four per player are usually the norm :)

The game sounds great, but watching the videos it seemed a very rare event, that 3-5 buildings where in play. Could a rule variant be made so you could have a longer game, like raid targets farther away, more raid targets and so on?

@NSKN. I know there are plenty of opportunities to score victory points and eventually win the game from every player, but is there an unfair advantage of being first player. It seems that they will play first every single round (or maybe i missed that). I think the randomness and amount of actions needed to score points will negate any advantage that first player gets. Just wanted to get your opinion.
@Elijah: Yes, a survey will be sent out at some point after the campaign is over.
I might be missing it, but when will we put in our shipping adressess? Will it be after the campaign is over?
http://www.galagalaxia.com/misc/AVATARS_InTheNameOfOdin_WithK.zip (645 KB)
Nevermind, that's when they first went to the British isles, but not truly raided until they sacked Lindisfarne 4 years later.
Psst, weren't the first documented viking raids in the year 789?
I agree . A stretch goal or option for female and distinct minis would be perfect.
Looks like fun. Any chance of a stretch goal for an alternate sculpt with female minis?
What does that mean (Later available also for sale as expansion or later in smaller amounts only available)?
@ Creator - thanks for considering it.
So raid BGG with art!
@Jardanes SG are already on Campaign page :) Quite sneaky I must say, since I waited for an update and found them by accident :D

@NSKN: Guys, do you ever sleep? You were responding to comments when it was around 3:00 AM in Poland and Romania and again when it was really early morning. Or was there too much adrinaline in your blood?
Wow, 200% of the goal! That's a very nice thing to see in the morning :D What a ride this has been... and we're less than 24 hours in! :D
Go, go, go!
Any possibility of previous games as add ons?
Another NSKN GAME, yeah =)
Vikings, NSKN, an enthusiastic Rahdo, Essen pick up, even plays well with two. So many reasons to back this project... Good luck with the campaign!
How well does this play with 2 players?

@Chuck: Welcome! Judging from past campaigns where I have seen you, you will not be disappointed! The community here and NSKN's presence is exactly what many of us have come to expect from any quality Kickstarter campaign.
@NSKN will we ever see this awesome game at Tabletopia just like we did with some of your other projects?
@NSKN: I also know that you have pets on the premises ;)
Looks like a fun game, can't wait to see the SGs. Congrats on funding, that's awesome.
Hahaha! Well, $50k by tomorrow sounds completely doable!
Challenge accepted.

@Creator "You can also check out our previous projects" That's what got me here in the first place! I'm eagerly waiting for Simurgh! played it a lot on tabletopia, so I already know it's awesome! (at least half of it, still missing the Dragonlord expansion!)

campaign.story:
Dear Backer, let us start a journey together into Teliad: a rich fantasy world illustrated in three different decks of poker playing cards: Teliad Heren, Teliad dùr and Teliad Alfrin. Please, follow us as we show you our project.
The deck, named Teliad Heren, represents nature, life, harmony, not “peace” since Humans, Orcs, Elves and Dwarves do battle and confront themselves. The back has elements from the four races and fuses them together in a new, innovative way. Gold foiling will embellish the tuck case (even without the stretch goal)
The back from Teliad Heren is a summary of all the graphic elements from the four races
The indices have a peculiar style, inspired by the runic alphabet
The Elves (clubs)
The Humans (hearts)
The jokers - inspired to the classic Dal Negro joker
A big summary with the faces of Teliad Heren
Alfrin stands for “immortal” and depicts the fantasy world of Teliad in an timeless, eternal life. That’s why Teliad Alfrin is decorated with gold and silver ink. All the colors of the characters will be printed in two layers: an underlying metallic ink and a CMYK print on top.
Alfrin will be limited to 1000 decks, and never printed again.
Alfrin tuck case with green foil and DRAGONSCALE paper
Alfrin hearts and diamonds
Alfrin clubs and spades
Alfrin jokers
The king of hearts in all his regal glory
The bold Queen of spades
Dwarves in heaven? Why not! They are hard workers, they deserve some peace
The brave Jack of spades
The dragon back of Teliad Alfrin. Green and silver ink
With Teliad dùr (obscurity), Darkness enters the world of Teliad. Dark colors, silver ink and new, twisted, details for all the court cards are the key features of this deck.
Teliad dùr is a stretch goal: when unlocked, pledges will change as stated in their description.
The tuck case in its (evil) glory
The king of hearts, after being corrupted by Darkness
The fine details of the back
How number cards and pips will look in Teliad dùr
Passione relies on LPCC for printing its own premium decks. LPCC is a reliable partner, already involved in the Love is a Smoke project.
Teliad will be printed with Elite finish.
LPCC's attention to details is "legendary"
A statement from LPCC: "At Legends PCC, our primary focus is producing the world’s finest playing cards for people who appreciate quality. Constantly staying on top of worldwide printing advances, we seek to apply these to playing card manufacturing and packaging design. With this project, we are looking forward to trying out a new and never before used paper stock for packaging, a premiere Italian paper supplier with a wide selection of brand new paper varieties. Quality and consistency is paramount when dealing with paper, and when you print with Legends, we can closely match the feel and durability of any of our in-house decks."
LPCC masters the art of printing playing cards

This time Passione Playing Cards together with LPCC will bring out custom tuck cases for the first time from a renowned Italian company, a leader in paper manufacturing: Fedrigoni.
...you won't find a finest paper than Fedrigoni's

Fedrigoni is not a new player in the market. It actually created the market itself, the Fedrigoni Group was born in 1717 AD. Now Fabriano is part of the Fedrigoni Group, it is worthwhile to remember that Fabriano invented modern paper, working on it since 1264 AD. It’s one of the most ancient “made in Italy” products you can think of.
We are still in the process of selecting the right paper for each tuck case.
After the main goal we already prepared some stretch goals. When Teliad dùr is unlocked, tiers with more than one deck will have it included.
During the campaign you will be able to customize your pledge by adding decks, uncut sheets or other objects unlocked during the campaign. You can't add Teliad Alfrin decks (the limited ones), but you can add uncuts.
Heren uncut (front)
Heren uncut (back)
Alfrin uncut (only back for now ;-) )
The leather pouch
They speak about us:
MaxPlayingCards 1: TELIAD Playing Cards. The “Passione” for Fantasy World inspired by Tolkien
MaxPlayingCards 2: TELIAD Playing Cards. The fantasy world is now a reality
Kardify: First Look: TELIAD by Passione Playing Cards
CardCulture, issue 16
from CardCulture, Issue 16
At Passione Playing Cards we do believe in teamwork. Meet the wonderful group behind this project:
Federico Bollo: core concepts, author of the original drawings & colors of Teliad Heren
PLAY

Maurizio Toccafondi (Colored Noise): the art director of the whole project, he personally designed Teliad Alfrin starting from Bollo’s work and the concept behind Teliad dùr
Jari di Benedetto: author of the calligraphic work on the three main writings: Teliad Heren, Alfrin and dùr
Andrea Aste: he created the awesome Teliad teaser and Kickstarter video and gave feedback and advice through the entire project
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Passione Playing Cards, LLC gained experience from the previous Kickstarter project: Love is a Smoke Classic Edition and therefore we think this one will be smoother. 

The artwork for Teliad Heren is 100% ready, Teliad Alfrin will be completed in the first days of the campaign and Teliad dùr will be completed when the stretch goal is reached. For all of those decks the decisions are almost 100% made so it's just a matter of completing the work.

LPCC can provide good fulfillment options and we will stay with them unless a better options is available.

Anyway, there can always be risks of delays for manufacturing activities and the realization of rewards that require craftsmanship. We decided to allow more time for the production and we are already anticipating some manufacturing options with LPCC, to save time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The campaign is over, HUGE THANK YOU TO ALL THE BACKERS!
Here is what we achieved so far:
Both tuck-boxes will have embossing
Both tuck-boxes will have "Natural Pearl" special paper
1.5" Antique Brass Dealer Coins released as add-on
Mini-decks released as add-on
Signed decks released as add-on
Custom brick box
GREEN VERSION UNLOCKED!
ALL UNLOCKED!
Ravn Playing Cards is a custom designed deck of poker size playing cards, designed by Stockholm17 for Caroline Ravn. We teamed up to deliver an elegant and classic looking deck of playing cards, with improved courts and standard pips. Perfect to perform magic tricks, cardistry, and of course to play at the green table.
The deck will be printed on Bicycle® paper stock by the United States Playing Card Company.
Project Creator Reliability Check: Caroline's campaign, production and fulfillment,  will be managed by herself and Requiem Team (a.k.a. Lorenzo Gaggiotti, or Stockholm17), who has already managed the following 4 successful Kickstarter campaigns:
Requiem / Heretic / No.17 / Le Chat Rouge .
If you have any doubt or question, do not hesitate to write an email :)
The look of the 12 court cards have been improved. The faces of the Jacks, Queens and Kings look better, and their hands have been redrawn as well.
improved design of the 12 figures, faces and hands
Ravn crimson red and petrol green
This deck features 56 cards with crimson red back.
52 cards +2 custom jokers 
gaff card "double queen"
gaff card "double backer"
Gaff Cards
The gaff cards are 2 extra cards that are included in the deck, which is made of 56 cards. The double queen and the double backer are great for magic tricks. Also the Joker with the hand has a reveal card drawn in it.
gaff card double queen
joker with reveal card: 2 of clubs
Back Design
back design (photoshop rendering) crimson red and petrol green
Here is the review on youtube, made by Scrambled Decks.
The plan is to have a tuck-box with embossing and "natural pearl" paper, which is slightly shimmering. Also this paper works very well with the embossing and it has a warm tone.
In the following pictures a homemade tuck-box mock-up with simulated embossing and paper.
The tuckbox will have no paper seal, it will be wrapped in cellophane.
Add-on  means that you can add one or more items on top of your pledge by doing simple math. Here the 3 add-ons
mini deck, brass coin, signed deck
Mini deck
Featuring a baby raven instead of the grown up one. It will appear on the Joker and the tuckbox. It´s half the size of a normal deck.
photoshop rendering
 1.5" Antique brass Coin
The pictures are photoshop rendering of how they should look. One side in 3D with 2 ravens (Hugin and Munin, Odin's raven in Norse Mythology). The circling swedish text means: "Hugin and Munin fly every day over the wide world". This text is taken from the Poetic Edda.
The other side is 2D, the dark areas are regressed metal.
It will be produced by Coinsforanything.com
photoshop rendering 3D side
2D side
Signed decks
with the signature of both of us, and a numbered custom seal. Please read the update #6 for more details.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed by USPCC (The United States Playing Card Co.) and shipped by Gamblers Warehouse (Texas).

The estimated delivery date is just that, an estimate. it depends on the factory and their workload. I will send the final files at the conclusion of the campaign, but I cannot speed up the production. There is a possibility of earlier delivery, but it all depends on how quickly USPCC completes the production, once I approve all the printing proofs.

Printing a deck of playing cards is a standard procedure, but errors may occur, you never know, the devil is in the details. This is my 5th Kickstarter project, even though I am managing Caroline's campaign. 
We both will keep the eyes open and follow every single step of the project to make it real.

Be aware that the colors on the screen and on the displayed prototype will not perfectly match with the colors on printed paper. Graphics may improve or change slightly in the final printed version.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Stockholm17 & Caroline Ravn
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Ravens!
Gemini is my zodiac sign and you can spot a little gemini symbol on Ravn back design. That was Lorenzo's hidden message to say that he was working on his new Gemini deck, but he had no clue it was also my zodiac sign and he asked me if I wanted to have my own. Coincidences are fascinating.

Hello Ravens! 
Quick update about the fulfillment. All the packages have been prepared and shipped. Many domestic parcels (USA) already arrived. As always the international parcels will take longer because - as you know - they have to go through the international hub, then travel, then go through the customs of each country. This is a process that might take up to 4 weeks, depending on the country and their import policies.

Hello everybody!
Got news from the fulfillment center. They started to work on the parcels and it takes some time with labels and packing. Meanwhile I can show you the REAL deck arrived straight from USPCC. They sent a split brick to me and Caroline. The combination of embossing and natural pearl paper is great!

campaign.story:
Over two years in the making, Mint playing cards are finally available now on Kickstarter. Luxury for the modern cardician.
The Design
A merger of form and function
We wanted to create a worker's deck. A pack of 52 cards that merges form with function. Using a classical approach to design, the goal was to develop a look that is familiar, but fresh. The elegant repeating pattern evokes the decks that have survived the test of time. Black Mint Playing Cards are luxury for the modern cardician.
Handling
Black Mint will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company on the highest quality card stock.
After we established the look, we focused on the feel. The true mark of a card is how it handles. The Black Mint deck will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company on the highest quality card stock available. It will be coated with the legendary Air Cushion Finish to provide for the smoothest spread, fans, and shuffles. 
Custom Faces
Classic court cards with a modern touch of MINT.
Everything about the Black Mint Deck is custom. The faces include custom fonts, pips, court cards, and Ace of Spades,  but we were careful to maintain the classic playing card look that we have all grown to recognize and love.
By Magicians, for Magicians
The back design features an intuitive marking system for magicians to take clever advantage of.
Our goal is to create harmony between the card and the cardician. Black Mint playing cards are a tool; and like great magic, they hide their best kept secret in plain sight. An innovative marking system opens up and endless world of possibilities. We have also included several gaff cards to help you perform special effects that you couldn't with an average deck.
Extra Cards Include a double backer and a double facer.
'Edge 52' Online Instructional Course
Each deck comes with an instructional course teaching you powerful effects with your deck.
Students of 52Kards know that we are also invested in the education of magic. Each Black Mint deck will come bundled with a free in depth instructional course that will teach you how to effectively use the built in marking system and included gaff cards. The course will also cover the use of a variety of other gimmicks in card magic.
The course will include chapters on the use of marked cards, duplicate cards, double backers, double facers, short cards, tapered cards, crimped cards, and more.
If you have been learning magic and sleight of hand technique from 52Kards.com or the 52Kards Youtube channel, then you will LOVE this course.
Raspberry Mint
Many backers have been asking if we will eventually produce a Mint deck that has a colored back design. This has been our intention all along as The Mint Collection is meant to be a complete line of playing cards with the Black Mint being the launch edition. The next edition we have planned is the Raspberry Mint deck (think the Black Mint deck, except in a beautiful shade of red), and we were originally going to release it next year sometime... However, due to the massive success of this project we are getting the Raspberry Mints printed at the same time as the Black Mints!
A mockup of the Raspberry Mint Deck. The exact shade of red may be subject to change.
If this stretch goal is reached, then backers will be given the opportunity to choose how many Black Mint decks and how many Raspberry Mint decks they want to get with their pledged money. 
Raspberry Mints will also be available as a $10 add on. They will NOT be limited, and will continue to be sold at 52Kards.com after they are printed. 
 The cards and tuck boxes will include all of the same features as the Black Mint deck (markings system, custom seal, embossed/foiled box, gaff cards, etc). 
 Once the campaign is over we will be sending out a survey to all of the backers and you will be given the opportunity to add any additional decks to your reward package.
 Limited Edition
We have a BIG update to the Black Mint Playing Cards Kickstarter project! In order to celebrate the massive support the project has already received we are introducing a new LIMITED EDITION Black Mint Deck! It's a beautiful tri-color design with gold line accents on a borderless card(see the picture below to behold it's full glory!). The borderless back is perfectly suitable for the Black Mint design and the touch of gold adds a rich aesthetic to the pattern.
A beautiful tri-color design with gold line accents on a borderless card.
Limited Edition Black Mint.
Limited Edition & standard Black Mints Limited Edition & standard Black.
Here's a few important points:
The Limited Edition Black Mint will be available exclusively through this Kickstarter project and will never be for sale again after the campaign is over. The regular Black Mint cards will be available at 52Kards.com once they are printed; although Kickstarter backers will be getting them sooner and at a discounted price. 
 The Limited Edition decks cost $15 each. To reserve your decks, simply add $15 to your pledge per deck. We will send out a survey at the end of the campaign to find out exactly what you want your pledged money to go towards.  Each person is allowed to purchase a maximum of 6x decks per person. We will strictly be enforcing this rule to keep these decks truly limited in nature. 
 The intuitive Mint Marking System will still be included in the Limited Edition decks. 
We are keeping the tuck box design a surprise for now, but trust us when we say it's going to be especially handsome. 
Limited Edition Black Mints are only available to backers of this project. After March 2nd you will no longer be able to become a backer. 
 If you don't know how to manage your pledge and add more money to your contribution you can see this video for more information:
Add Ons
Black Mint Deck - $10 per deck
Raspberry Mint Deck - $10 per deck
Limited Edition Black Mint Deck - $15 per deck
Mint Stripper Deck - $15 per deck
Black Mint Uncut Sheet - $40 each
Raspberry Mint Uncut Sheet - $40 each
Limited Edition Uncut Sheet - $50 each
Stretch Goals
Free USA Shipping when you get 6 decks or more
 Would you like to add extra rewards to your pledge level? Click this video to see how.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only challenge is getting enough funding to get the decks printed. The United States Playing Card Company requires a minimum order of 2,500 decks in order for them to print your design. As you can imagine, this amounts to a large amount of money, which is why we are asking for your support in this Kickstarter campaign.

Everything else is ready to go. Once we have the funds we will be ready to print. Your rewards will be sent to you as soon as production is complete, which we expect to be in June of 2016 (hopefully sooner).
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!!! It's been a while since I've sent an update through here... 
Thanks you again for all of your amazing support on the original MINT Playing Cards project! These cards never would have become a reality without you. The Launch Edition MINT decks we got printed through the first Kickstarter project were extremely well received and have been sold out for over a year now. It feels like the right time to bring back MINT with a new and improved Second Edition...

updates.update_userinfo: A note about the Mint Stripper decks
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Just wanted to drop a quick note about the Mint Stripper decks in case your ordered one. These decks will already be open when they arrive. Our card gaffer Jeremy Hanrahan had to open each deck to gaff them by hand before returning them to the box. This is a standard practice when creating Stripper decks. We received a few messages from a few concerned backers who have never purchased a Stripper deck before so I just wanted to clear that up!
I'll be adding some content to the Edge 52 course going over the use and applications of the Stripper deck in the near future.

updates.update_userinfo: We need a favor... and some final thoughts on the project! [Video Update]
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
Most of you have received your cards by now and we are wrapping up the final pieces of the project. We have one more favor to ask for... Please watch the video update below for some final thoughts on the project and a request!

updates.update_userinfo: Mint Stripper Decks are almost ready to be shipped!
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
Quick update. If you pledged for a Premium MINT Stripper deck then you have been waiting super patiently for your reward packages to be shipped out while the decks have been masterfully gaffed by the Jeremy Hanrahan of the Hanrahan Gaff Co. The completed decks are being shipped to us at the moment and we expect to begin shipping them out next week! There are quite a few reward packages that require Stripper decks so it will take us some time to get through all of them but we are getting much closer to having all of the packages shipped out. Thanks again for being so patient!

updates.update_userinfo: BETA Access for the Edge 52 Instructional Course
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,
We have officially begun the distribution stage of the project! 
This will be done in several stages and will begin with the domestic USA packages and then move onto international packages. 
If you pledged for a premium stripper Mint deck, then we will have to wait a little more while before shipping your package as these decks are currently in the process of being gaffed in Canada. We expect all of the stripper decks to be ready for shipping in 1-2 weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys closing. Last chance to get the Limited Edition Mint!

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers!
July is here and I would like to provide another status update on the project! The logistics have been more time consuming than originally expected but good progress has been made. All of the contracts have been signed and the full payment has been made to the United States Playing Card Company. We have been in the queue to get the cards printed for a while now, but they have a backlog of other projects to complete first so we are just waiting on them at this point. Also, at the start of every July their factory shuts down for approximately two weeks to do yearly maintenance on their equipment, so this is causing another delay. They cannot give an exact date yet for when the cards will be ready but they have agreed to expedite our project once the factory re-opens and everything should be ready towards the end of July. Distribution will begin immediately afterwards!

updates.update_userinfo: July Update and the Mint Marking System.
updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,
We are approaching the end of May and I'd like to update you on the status of the Mint! Our original expected delivery during the campaign was June and we are trying our best to achieve this. This project has been more work than originally anticipated and there have been a few delays, so there's a chance we may have to push the delivery to July. This is our first custom deck and we want to make sure every we take all the time necessary to make sure everything is done right. We promise it will be well worth the wait!

campaign.story:
The Infinite Collision "Playing Cards Deck" is a graphic design collaboration project aiming to reveal a fascinating universe of ever evolving styles through the eyes of some of Bulgaria’s most talented designers and artists.
The "Playing Cards Deck" is a compilation of 55 unique playing cards, each one designed by a different designer or artist. The participants have been given full freedom to express their own unique style through the interpretation of their chosen card. The deck thus presents you with a kaleidoscope of design styles ranging from illustration, 3D art, concept drawings, typography, to character design and many more.
You can have the Infinite Collision playing cards deck in two different styles. Choose the one you like the most!
 Have a sneak peak of how and why our artists and designers drew what they did!
Jelio Dimitrov Arsek (4 of Clubs) - Let me show you how I did it!
Pavel Popov (4 of Spades) - Classic deck improvisation, inspired by the Magic: The Gathering playing game.
Tochka Ilieva (J of Clubs) - Can you spot the cat (which is actually the boss of the kettle ship)?
 Ivan Popov (K of Spades) - Meet the Mad King!
 Neli Drumeva (2 of Clubs) - When black is white and white is black!
Lubomir Arsov (K of Clubs) - I was inspired to illustrate an idea seemingly long lost to humanity; that of a virtuous leader.
Kostadin Kostadinov (3 of Clubs) - 3 octopuses in the silhouette of a Club!
 Petya Savova (Q of Spades) - The old legend lives again!
Kaloian Toshev aka MZK (Q of Clubs) - This artwork tells the story of a girl that used to be very religious but then met Satan, who is pouring dark sludge over her, turning her to the dark side.
The 4 Ace`s of Infinite Collision
The Infinite Collision illustrated playing cards deck features two gorgeous visions – Royal Blue and Pitch Black.
The Royal Blue design’s matte background beautifully contrasts with the glossy finish of the embossed intricate red pattern, resulting in an opulent design that is appealing to the eye and really nice to touch.
The Pitch Black design is a stealthy minimalistic one, with matte black background paired with an embossed pattern in glossy finish. This exquisitely premium option is executed on a heavier paper, ensuring a magnificent card experience while dealing and playing.
The Royal Blue deck is available in 290gm double-sided mate paper with a partial UV coating ensuring a smooth glide and ultimate longevity.
The Pitch Black comes in 310gm chromium paper also with double sided paper mate and glossy embossing on the back of the cards, ensuring unique and premium experience.
 These shirts can feature any image you like from the deck,from Ace of Spades to 2 of Clubs. Each shirt is crafted in Europe using soft comfortable fabric that feels like you've owned it for ages! All sizes are available, but please mention your size in the pledge, or else we will send you an XS one.
The Infinite Collision playing cards deck is also available on a limited number of Uncut sheets, which display the eclectic and extravagant project in its full glory. A fixed number of these sheets will be pulled straight from the factory floor, never to be printed again. Individually numbered, these dazzling pieces of art are a true inspiration, made for the most passionate collectors.
*Sheets are shipped unframed."
Support the Infinite Collision playing cards deck project by getting one of our 8 awesome pledge sets. Each set includes lots of exclusive goodies and fan stuff. The more you pledge, the more you get! Shipping is free, we will take care of it!
Infinite Collision is a Bulgarian design collaboration community revealing the ever evolving styles of design through unique conceptual projects. Help us achieve our goals and show these awesome artworks to the world!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Many of the risks and challenges stem from production and shipping. We have properly calculated and compensated for these two things to ensure that our backers will get their custom decks within a timely manner.

The producer of the cards will be based in Europe and shipping will be done through our international partners. Of course, if there any issues throughout the project, we will inform you in a timely manner and will find a way to deliver as promised.

Production should take around 6 to 8 weeks, given there are no intervening holidays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
