campaign.story:
Custom illustrated deck by Nat Iwata 
Intricately designed playing card backs
Richly illustrated  
One of a kind court cards with characters based on GREMLINS
Custom Jokers 
Magic finish that allows cards to handle smoothly & last longer than cheaper playing card decks
You may have seen our work on the Alien, Angelarium, Breaking Bad, Ghostbusters, The Goonies, The Princess Bride, Dragon Tome, Synthesis, The White Rabbit, or The Call of Cthulhu decks that we've done. 
We are extremely fortunate to have the opportunity to work with Warner Bros. and Nat Iwata again so that we can bring another quality product to Kickstarter.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with every project, we run the risk of natural disasters and other cataclysmic events interfering with manufacturing and shipping schedules.

Having run a few successful Kickstarters previously, we've gotten a pretty good process down for handling pledges, shipping, and fulfillment. We can't promise that there won't be any mistakes, but we've worked very hard to make sure that there won't be many.

This project has very few deliverables, the art is already completed and we're in the final stages of approval. We are also using our fastest and most reliable vendors. This gives us an excellent idea about their accuracy in costs and turnaround time so that we have been able to plan accordingly.

And just like any other GREMLIN, don't get them wet!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Thanks to everyone who supported our previous campaigns, the painted aggressive and defensive stance playing card decks and hearts of darkness decks have been printed.
Painted Illustrated aggressive and defensive decks.
 We still have more decks to sell and we're now presenting the new, more traditional Fantasy Comic deck featuring the same characters.
Feature; Kingdoms of Erden: Fantasy Comic Playing Cards.
 Now I am pleased to present the new designs for the "fantasy comic" deck. These card designs will be more traditional, but still capture the fun of the fantasy world of Kingdoms of Erden.
Reaching our Primary goal will print the feature Fantasy comic decks using 270gsm promotional quality card stock with blue core. MPC printing. The more we sell, the more we will print. The more we print, the cheaper the cost of printing. I've set up the stretch goals so that as the quantity of decks ordered grows, we will upgrade the card stock quality.
We've created some new fun comic style fantasy face cards and more colorful card backs.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With previous experience in fulfilling projects, the risks and challenges are extremely low. I have already been in talks with the printing company Legends Playing Card Co. and have already accepted the artwork and design. The project will be aimed to have it printed and shipped to backers in October 2015.

As most of you will be probably concerned about shipping, the best solution is to have the playing cards sent to a Hong Kong fulfilment centre from the Taiwan factory and then shipped worldwide. That is why the costs can be this low to have it shipped across the world.

The whole process: 
1. Deck gets funded 
2. Printing starts with LPPC 
3. Decks get shipped to Hong Kong fulfilment centre 
4. Decks get send out to all backers

Have more questions? Feel free to ask in the comments section!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far as designing custom playing cards are concerned, we have done it half a dozen time so no issues there.

However we are new to the whole production game but we have our strategy and plans in place.

Our designs are already been approved my the Legal Team of USPCC and so once we get successfully funded all that would remain is to sign the contract with them.

Our next challenge would be "distribution". So, we already have our crew member stationed in USA to overlook the shipping of your packages.

We are keeping a close eye on every aspect related to this project because we are desperate to bring "Classic" in our time.

campaign.story:
Who is TriKard Projects? TriKard is the same collaborative group that brought the award winning Aquila Playing Cards to Kickstarter just over a year ago as Kardify Projects. That collaboration between exceptionally talented Indonesian designer Ade Suryana of “The Three of Clubs” and the team from the on-line playing card resource site, Kardify.com, helmed by Ivan Choe and Anthony Ingrassia, struck a surprising balance with each bringing their own unique piece to the puzzle, but ultimately striving for the same goal, quality products that can be enjoyed by all Playing Card aficionados. TriKard Projects is our long term commitment to that vision.
Designed by Ade Suryana, Viridian playing cards feature a custom vintage design, reimagined courts, a beautifully crafted tuck case and a stamp bearing an intricate custom design. A deck that is as beautiful as it is functional, Viridian is the first in Trikard’s new line of Signature playing cards - versatile for magic, card flourishing or even just a game of poker.
A modern twist inspired by the classics.
Viridian combines distinctive design with the peerless quality of Legends Playing Card Co. The beautiful typography is based on vintage typeface and inspired from old Billheads and ephemera. The tuck is also elegantly adorned with beautiful organic patterns which is especially striking. Viridian will be meticulously printed on Classic Finish card stock by LPCC, well known for their innovation, attention to detail with exceptional durability, ultra-precise printing registration and the ‘glass like’ edges of their signature ‘Diamond Cut’ process. 
TriKard Custom Seals
Entirely new, yet immediately familiar.
From the moment you take the Viridian cards out, you will be comfortable using them. The deck looks amazingly fresh. But it’s visually reminiscent of what you’re used to seeing, and is designed around familiarity. The pips on Viridian have been given an update with timeless custom suits and a bigger font for the lettering and numbers.
Meticulously designed from the ground up by hand.
The court cards are stunning and each card has a different face and each with its own uniquely designed wardrobe which looks amazing with the theme color: green and deep red. This gives a good balance of having a beautiful design while keeping the integrity of a standard deck of playing cards.
Beautifully crafted. Sure to draw compliments every time the cards are cut.
Viridian features an intricate, mirror image floral design on the card backs inspired by traditional playing cards. The attention to detail and craftsmanship, makes this deck truly unique and one of a kind.
Inspired by vintage design and refined by modern aesthetics.
The Ace of Spades features a beautiful intricate design that is bold and stylish. The abstract floral pattern adds to the elegance and identity of Viridian.
Example-U.S Backers: You pledged for the Dual reward tier at AUD $25.00 and would like to add-on 1 additional Viridian deck to your reward.
Your total pledge amount would be AUD $39.00
AUD $25.00 (Your Pledge Tier) + AUD $14.00 (Add-on A1) = AUD $39.00 Pledge
_________________________________________________________________
Example-Non US Backers: You pledged for the Dual reward tier at AUD $25.00 and would like to add-on 1 additional Viridian deck to your reward.
Your total pledge amount would be AUD $62.00
AUD $39.00 (Your Pledge Tier + AUD $14 Shipping) + AUD $23.00 (Add-on A1) = AUD $62.00 Pledge
Please use the add-on chart above as a guide or contact us with any questions.
Introducing Carmine Playing Cards.
This striking deck of cards is the sequel to Viridian and was planned to be released next year. As a Stretch Goal, $19,800 (~$14,500 USD) will allow us to bring Carmine exclusively to our backers early before the public release next year. (Additional mixed reward tiers will be added once we reach the stretch goal)
*Image of prototype deck
Viridian Playing Cards are designed by Ade Suryana. Check out our online store on Storenvy.
Follow TriKard Projects on Facebook to keep up-to-date on specials, news and future releases.
Thanks to Andri Asmara for his AMAZING renders.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second playing card project and like all projects there are always risks in getting a product to market. The designs for both Viridian and Carmine have been completed and ready for production. The decks will be printed by LPCC on their classic finish stock. 

Printing will begin within 35 days after the paper proofs are confirmed. The paper proofs can take anywhere from 3-8 week to get to us. We have been in constant contact with LPCC thoughout the planning phase and will continue to do so during the production phase. 

Fulfilment can be one of the most challenging aspects of any project. To ensure the best experience for all our backers, we have decided to stick with Collectible Playing Cards (CPC)- the same company that successfully delivered Aquila Playing Cards all across the globe. As we have good relationship with CPC, we will oversee the fulfilment to ensure the process is smooth and efficient.

Delays may occur and in such case we will be updating everyone with regards to the delivery status. We have given ourselves a buffer and we are confident we can deliver Viridian to you in the time we’ve quoted.

As the project is quoted in AUD$ and payments are in USD$, there will be Foreign Exchange Risk due to volatility in the currency exchange rate. The exchange rate quoted by the bank: (AUD 1 = USD 0.72940).
*Please note that Viridian will be fulfilled out of the U.S.*
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Backers,  
We hope everyone is doing well, we wanted to share our latest collaboration with all of you. Kardify has been part of the International Cardistry Open for the past 3 years and the worldwide tournament gets bigger and better every year. Cardists from around the world show off their card handling skills and compete head to head until a winner is crowned!  
This year Kardify collaborated with The Expert Playing Card Company and designer Brendan Hong to design a bold, colorful and unique cardistry deck to celebrate the competition. The 2016 ICO Deck (International Cardistry Open)

Hey Backers,
Kickstarter has always been a place for bringing dreams to reality. For us it’s playing cards, and as we strive to bring the best we can to the community, there are others who are putting in just as much work in bringing their own vision to life.
One of our favorite designers is currently running his own campaign, Brendan Hong, the designer who brought us The Hive Series through Kings Wild Project has embarked on his first solo campaign, Dynasty. A beautifully Asian themed deck in Brendan’s signature style.
If you haven’t already, give Dynasty a look and help bring another quality project to life.

Hello Backers,
We wanted to Thank all of you once more for your support and understanding. As always, these projects don't become reality without your help. 
I hope everyone enjoys Viridian, and while the campaign is over and rewards have been delivered, we're always here to answer any questions about Viridian or anything else.

Hello everyone, 
So we started fulfillment on Monday and as of Tuesday morning all but 15 rewards were shipped. As of today, all rewards with completed surveys have now been sent on there way. 
We do have 8 backers who have not completed their surveys, if your one of them, please do so, we don't want you to miss out on Viridian!

campaign.story:
Here they are, in all of their vintage glory. The Bicycle Pin-Up deck by Classics Playing Cards is now available on Kickstarter. 
She's risqué but never explicit. She's flirtatious but fiercely independent. She's erotic but always safe for work, a welcome sight for your teenage cousin and prudish mother alike. She's the pin-up girl, an all natural American sweetheart created to win the adoration of men across the country. Printed on Bicycle's Air-Cushion Finish
NEW! Get your free Limited Edition Vintage Pin-Up Bottle Cap! Included in pledges of 3 or more Pin-Up Decks. These Bottle Caps bring back the old charm of 50's picnics in the park. There's nothing like enjoying a refreshing soda and playing with your brand new Pin-Up Deck :)
The Pin-Up girl craze started as far back as the late 1800's. Back then they were known as Calendar Girls. These lovely ladies were put onto Calendars to help spice up the ad industry. Needless to say, calendars sales were never hotter. 
These women knew how to get their way and they did with style as sass. Pin-Up girls have always shown the best aspects of a woman, including their work ethic, their determination and their edge. Oh, and they made sure they looked fabulous when doing so. 
War Time Girls. It started back in WWI When Gibson Girls were willing and ready to join the fight for their country! During WWII there was a peak in the Pin-Up with girls dressing a bit more scandalous and giving way to a golden age in US History throughout the 40s and 50s. Celebrities started getting in on the fun as well with Rita Hayworth as the leader of the pack. Little did we know it would open the flood gates to a whole new generation on bombshells. 
60s Pin-Up brought with it the sexy swim suit and of course Playboy. Also with the help of Audrey Hepburn , Marilyn Monroe and Sophia Loren woman were beginning to feel a lot more confident in their skin.
We haven't seen as many appearances by these beauties in today's culture. Dita Von Teese and Katy Perry are a few that come to mind. However, these ladies always seem to make a comeback. 
With a new era upon us we can not wait to see what these Pin-Up ladies have in store. It has become an American Classic and that is why we have created The Bicycle Pin-Up Deck.
 The Fan!
 Eat your heart out Harley Quinn :)
Almost as beautiful as the ladies. These pips really pop and appeal to the Pin-Up fashion patterns. 
Clear, Clean and Crisp. These numbered cards are easy to read and look great during a game or just to admire.

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarter, my name is Nastya, I’m a graphic designer.
I am really excited to launch my first playing card project named AO MATU. Fully custom stunning deck of 54 playing cards for collectors, poker, magic, cardistry, designers and artists.
I travel a lot and inspiration comes from many places such as Islands and Nature most of all from Polynesian Triangle. Almost 8 years ago it was the very first time when I thought about creating playing cards but it happened only now; finally, during three month I made my own deck and it’s brilliant.
The name of cards - AO MATU, it goes from Tongan language, one of the muiltiple languages in the Polynesia. AO mean WORLD, MATU is ISLAND. I spent a lot of time making each character uniq. Every card has its own cool detailes, marked with 4 distinguishing motifs. Design is full of different vegetation, forms of the relief and mountains of the Island.
There are 4 tribes of warriors, each suit – each tribe. Jacks, Queens, Kings, Aces and Jokers – characters. Number cards – relief of the island. Back – vegetation, jungles of AO MATU, world where your warriors hide from the opponent.
Please share this project with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, you can use this link: http://kck.st/1SWqzl3
If you don't see you country in shipment list, please drop me a line and we will figure it out! 
Mock up of the tropical tuck box.
Mock up of the tuck box.
Mock up of the back.
Mock up of a Jack card. The Jack of Spades.
Mock up of a Queen card. The Queen of Clubs.
Mock up of a King card. The King of Clubs.
Mock up of an Ace card. The Ace of Diamonds.
Mock up of a number card. The 2 of Hearts.
Lemurs are my Jokers =___=
Mock up of the King of Hearts and tuck box back.
It will be great to see people playing AO MATU cards around the world, especially on islands or in travels! Sketches and more details you can find here: kaerfkrahs.com
Posters:
When you order poster(s) you can choose your own character and I’ll make poster specially for you! Just add to composition: Floral elements, Island relief and your favourite warrior. Make it unique! Send me email with your choice after you’ll make an order.
#1 Mock up of Poster 16"x24" (A2 format) in frame. Frame is not included.
#2 Mock up of Poster 16"x24" (A2 format) in frame. Frame is not included.
 Music for video by: PΔPER CHOIR – Invaders.
 The AO MATU deck will be printed by the Legends Playing Card Co. (LPCC). Their card stock is made from top-tier imported paper that is thinner, yet stiffer.
USPCC (Left) & Precision Cutting by LPCC (Right)
When project successfully gets funded it’ll take about 35 working days (almost 2 months) for production + delivery time depending on your country. So I hope that overall it will take about 2.5 - 3 months. Playing cards will be shipped from Hong Kong’s Fulfillment center.
Manufacturing & Fulfillment:
The AO MATU deck will be manufactured by the Legends Playing Cards Company, which is a well known company by playing card enthusiasts. The quality of their decks are among the best of the world. To ensure that your cards arrive quickly and safely, LPCC will also handle the fulfillment of the decks. Having manufactured and distributed pledges for countless successful campaigns, no other card company does logistics better than Legends.
Timeline:
1. AO MATU playing cards project goes live on Kickstarter.
2. Project gets funded. 
3. LPCC starts deck production. 
4. Decks will be shipped to the Hong Kong fulfillment centre.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Follow my Twitter and Instagram for more process and updates.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Below is a video on How to Manage Your Pledge for add-ons:
https://vimeo.com/67736084
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first project and everything is new to me. It took me three months to draw all cards and another two months to prepare text, sketches, create a video and calculate all production, shipping and it takes a lot of expenses. A lot of work and pressure. Now I know why many people gave up in the middle of their projects. 
I did a lot of research and I am sure that with an experienced partner like LPCC who will handle deck production and distribution, I have minimized the risks as much as possible.

I understand that every project might have unexpected delays so I will do my best to prevent this and deliver playing cards and rewards on time, before October 2015. I’ll keep you updated about all developments.

Please share this project with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, you can use this link:
http://kck.st/1SWqzl3

Hope you'll like it and thank you for your support!

If you have any questions do not hesitate to drop me a line!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
For information on the status of this deck and where to find the print-and-play rules, please visit:
http://www.culturlan.com/
Two years ago we started a journey of discovery in producing three decks of playing cards suffused with Celtic mythology. Now we are completing that set with our final deck suggestive of the wild, chthonic forces of nature as opposed to the stabilizing, societal forces represented in our second deck. In addition and unique to this Kickstarter campaign is an altogether new game, designed for use with our decks and capturing the heroic spirit of early society in Celtic Europe. 
Printing the 3rd and final deck in the Celtic Myth playing card series
Providing the rules and final game components to ARD RÍ, a competitive card game designed for 2 to 5 players in which players take on the role of ancient Gaelic warlords and vie amongst each other to become High King.
GAME REVIEW
GeekDad Review by Will James (7 June 2015).
THE CARDS
Each of our decks in this series contains imagery hand-drawn from the history and mythology of the Celts, presenting illuminations rich with symbolism. The first two decks in the series were printed and delivered to our Kickstarter backers last year (to whom we offer our deep gratitude). This final deck features vertically symmetrical (i.e. two-way) designs for the face-cards and back showcasing the more chaotic elemental forces of Celtic legend and cosmology.
To give you a sense of the detail contained in each deck, the image below showcases the King of Clubs (Spears) from each of our three decks: The first two (left to right) are from the previously printed decks, and the third is one of the cards which will be included in this deck (featuring the Femorian King, Balor).
For a look at all the court cards, continue reading below.
Our cards are uncommon in that our artist, James Acken, has used his background as both a scholar and artist to draw these images, creating a detailed tapestry of symbolism throughout.
Evoking the highly involved symbolism of the Book Kells and other medieval artifacts, each Court card represents important figures from the Book of Invasions, Colloquy of the Ancients, and other medieval legends. In this image, Lugh and Balor, the embattled grandson and grandparent from the Second Battle of Magh Tuireadh, are shown in opposition to one another, Lugh with his unstoppable spear and Balor with his irresistibly poisonous gaze. As with the prior two we successfully Kickstarted, this deck will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC) and will contain:  
a custom back,
12 custom-designed Court Cards (Jacks, Queens, Kings),
36 custom-designed pip cards (unique to the set, but common across it) ,
4 custom-designed Aces (unique to the set, but common across it),
2 custom-designed Jokers, and  
1 info card concerning the company or a custom designed Cut Card (depending on if we break through the 12.5K Stretch Goal).
1 info card detailing the symbolism of the card back and where one can go to find more information (www.culturlan.com). 
The tuck box featuring the card back, as well as the majority of the court cards, can be viewed below.
ABOUT THE PIPS
While the usual suits are recognizable in our deck, we present them as the four jewels of the Tuatha Dé Danann, magical items of immense power representing among other things martial prowess, wealth, abundance, and leadership.
All of the Spades are bisected by the Sword of Nuadha, also known as the Sword of Valor, which was said to help the bearer to defeat any opponent they faced in combat. It provided its bearer with the insight to discern order from the seeming chaos of battle.
The Diamond symbol surrounds the Lia Fáil, which is a stone in Ireland said to shout aloud when beneath the one meant to be the High King. Still standing in the heart of Ireland and comparable to the Stone of Scone of Scotland, the Lia Fáil represents the wealth and status inherent to the Celtic ideal of nobility and good rulership.
Hearts represent the Dadga's Cauldron embodying the principle of abundance. The cauldron throughout Celtic tradition is a symbol of poetic inspiration, brewing intoxicating pleasure from the viscera of human experience.
The Clubs are each pierced by the Spear of Lugh, as shown in the picture featured at the top of the project page. It was not only irresistible but the weapon of a true leader as no army could stand against the one who wielded it.
THE GAME
PLAY

ARD RÍ is a 2 to 5 player strategic competitive card game, designed for players ages 14 and up. Average game-play time is 30 to 60 minutes. 
In the game, players take on the role of ancient Gaelic warlords and compete among each other to collect the most wealth in order to force the other players to acknowledge them as the ARD RÍ (i.e. the High King).
There are two different types of cards in the game: 
Cattle cards, represented by the numbered cards and the Aces, and 
Warrior Cards, represented by the Court cards (i.e. Jacks, Queens, and Kings) 
Cattle cards are synonymous with wealth and are worth the number represented on the card. For example, a 10 is worth 10 cattle-points, and a 4 is worth 4 cattle-points. Aces each represent a Bull and are worth 15 cattle-points apiece. The different suits represent different types of cattle. Cattle cards are played face-up into a player’s gort (i.e. their cattle-field). This is the open area in front of each player. 
Warrior cards are ranked such that Kings will defeat Queens and Jacks in battle, and Queens will defeat Jacks. When cards of equal rank battle, both are killed. Warrior Cards are initially played face-down into a player’s Roundhouse, which is the open area adjacent to a player's gort. When they have proven themselves in Raiding or Defense, warriors are turned face-up and are considered "Proven". Proven warriors provide the player who controls them with additional benefits (though they also come with additional restrictions).
Play progresses through the seasons of the year, with each season providing players with the opportunity to engage in specified actions. For instance, Cattle are added to a player’s wealth in Spring, with Warriors flocking to banners in the Summer. Wealth is acquired from the wilds during the harvest time of Autumn, with the Harvest Feast of Samhain occurring at the end of that season. At the Harvest Feast, players are required to feed those Warriors they wish to remain under their banner. Winter is a time of hunting, raiding, and politicking, when fortunes can change in a heartbeat. 
Play continues until one player accumulates enough wealth or warriors to force the issue and cause the others to acknowledge them as High King. 
The game comes with three editions:
a Children's Edition (designed for children ages 5 to 13), 
the Basic game (described above), & 
an Advanced Edition which features special powers for each of the figures displayed on the Jacks, Queens, & Kings - drawn directly from the mythology.
Please note that while 1 deck can support a 2-player game, we recommend 2 decks for games of 3 to 4 players, and 3 decks for 5-player games.
THE TUCK
For our third deck, we are offering our packing in Classical Gaelic, the common ancestor of Irish and Scottish Gaelic.
THE CARD BACK
THE COURT CARDS
In the emblem of the diamond is the silhouette of the Lia Fáil.
The spear of Lugh is at the heart of the suit of clubs.
Hearts are based on the cauldron of the Daghda, a cauldron that shows up in Welsh mythology as a cauldron of poetic inspiration.
Spades are based on the Sword of Nuadha.
ABOUT THE SYMBOLISM
The early cultures of Europe conceived reality as being more than what it seemed. Appearances were inherently deceiving because super-normal powers could appear human, animal, and any combination thereof. Giants were not always enormous, hulking monsters but could appear as a normal human being or an insignificant animal. This is why the ogre in the original Puss in Boots could turn into a mouse and be eaten by the eponymous hero. 
Nevertheless, the clever and resourceful could look past appearances and see the reality behind them by reading the unobtrusive clues. These clues form a vocabulary of symbols associated with the powers behind them: the swans associated with Manannán mac Lír, the battle, madness and death associated with the Neamhain, or the golden, youthful beauty associated with the Bodhbh Dearg. Each image on the cards is constructed by assembling such symbols and depicting them with the clarity and realism expected by modern audiences. The lover of Celtic myth, returning to such collections as Jeffrey Gantz’s Early Irish Myths and Sagas or Tales of the Elders of Ireland by Ann Dooley and Harry Roe, will find the characters more familiar and recognizable having studied our cards. 
In addition, all of the images reflect the material culture of the medieval and classical Celts, incorporating La Tène and Hallstatt designs with that of the Book of Kells and Tara Brooch among many others. Our goal is to reconnect with the artistic inspiration of the Celts from the long past and extrapolate it into our time, remaining true to the original muse while bringing it into our modern world. 
ADD-ONS
ADDITIONAL DECKS ($12):
Please add $12 for each additional deck you'd like us to include with your pledge rewards. You will be able to specify which deck you'd like mailed to you (the asymmetrical, the original symmetrical design, or our newest deck) at the end of the campaign.
Canadians: Please include an additional $3 per deck for S&H.
All other international locations: please include an additional $6 per deck for S&H.
Asymmetrical Deck
Original Symmetrical Deck
STRIPPER DECKS ($15): Please add $15 for each stripper deck you'd like us to include with your pledge rewards.  
Canadians: Please include an additional $3 per deck for S&H. 
All other international locations: please include an additional $6 per deck for S&H.
CHALLENGE COINS ($12):
The two sides of the Challenge Coin
Each coin is 1.75" with an antique silver finish and a reeded edge (note please that the metal is NOT silver; it has a finish designed to make it appear similar to antique silver). The designs and text are raised. 
Additional items which incorporate the history and mythology of the Celts are available on our website.
PLEDGE LEVELS
STRETCH REWARDS
$17,500. A cut card included with the deck, featuring custom artwork on both sides of the card. Limited edition (Quantity limited to the print run associated with this Kickstarter project). Provided to all backers receiving a deck.
$22,500. Videos of game-play, rules clarification, and stories about the mythology posted to our website, based on requests by backers.
$27,500. App provided to all backers to serve as a reference for the Celtic figures and their related powers in the advanced version of the game.
$35,000. Deluxe version of downloadable rules which includes in-line graphics and unique artwork. Provided to all backers.
ABOUT THE ARTIST
James Acken, Ph.D., is both a professional illustrator with a focus on design as well as a trained medievalist with a focus on early poetic culture in Northern Europe. He brings more than seven years’ experience researching and teaching mythology, history and related subjects at the university level. The combination of his academic background with his artistry provides him with the ability to produce images that are deeply informed by myth and long-established traditions of storytelling.
ABOUT THE GAME DESIGNERS
Ard Rí has been designed by three members of the Cultúrlán team and refined by an army of play-testers, to whom we owe a deep debt and are profoundly grateful. 
The three members of the Cultúrlán team are James Acken, Jay Henry, and Todd Silverstein. All three have been gaming addicts from an early age and can still often be found playing games or "discussing" rules while desperately searching for supporting evidence of their interpretation on BoardGameGeek and other sites.
ABOUT THE COMPANY
We at Cultúrlán seek to re-contextualize historic practices and beliefs in an effort to make them more accessible. Through a combination of free market tools, academic expertise, and innovative creativity, we attempt to blur the boundaries between education and entertainment, offering highly functional products and services informed with a deeply knowledgeable aesthetic.
www.culturlan.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've previously successfully funded and printed a playing card project through Kickstarter and we have a very good handle on the process. Additionally, we are working with great people at the USPCC Custom Division to print these decks. To top things off, the game has been playtested extensively and almost all of the card artwork is finished; we are simply waiting on the funds to go to print.

All of that said, there is always the chance of an unexpected delay.

We will work hard to ensure no delays occur, but should we at any point believe we are behind schedule, we promise to advise you of the issue and what we are doing to resolve it. We also promise to stay in contact with you at least once per week until project rewards are shipped. And if the project is funded, rewards WILL be shipped. 

We take the trust you place in us quite seriously, and we will work hard to ensure you never have cause to regret your decision to back us. We will do our utmost to be responsive to emails and comments. But there's no need to take our word for it. We encourage you to read the comments, updates, and reviews of our other projects here on Kickstarter, as well as reviews of our products and company on sites such as Amazon. 

Feel free to email us with any questions, comments, or concerns you have either here on Kickstarter or at <info@culturlan.com>. 

Thanks for your support.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WE HAVE CANCELED THIS CAMPAIGN ONLY TO RELAUNCH IN TWO WEEKS. For more details please check the updates section, our facebook page or the Battalia website.
"Awesome Artwork, Awesome Gameplay....the game is well designed, well balanced and a very deep strategy game"
Michael Von Kirchmeyer, Off The Shelf Board Game Reviews
"Battalia is a game with tons of variety and options....Accessible and easy to learn...and It looks really, really EPIC!"
Nick Meenachan, Board Game Brawl
"There is so much about the game that I enjoy.....It's like deck building Heroes of Might and Magic...I had a lot of fun with this game!"  
Undead Viking
"After I had the pleasure to test the prototype, Battalia became one of the most anticipated titles for me this year."
Nikolay Zhekov, GameBox.bg
"Battalia is an excellent game with a lot of original ideas..... I highly recommend you to buy the game upon release. I know I will."
Deyan Georgiev, BigBoxGamers.com
Hello Everybody, And Welcome To The World Of Battalia!
First, let me introduce ourselves with one sentence. We are a small team of passionate board game players, (including a warrior, a snow queen, a leprechaun, a dwarf, a giant and a dream walker), who also have some experience in board game publishing and who with a little help form their friends, after more than 2 years of development, have finally finished their first own game. Hurray!! If you want to learn more about us, check our bio, website and the information at the bottom.
Now, let me walk you trough our project.
What kind of game is this?
BATTALIA: The Creation is a medium weight strategy game for 2-4 players, ages 13 and up. An expansion for up to 6 players is on our schedule, but for now let’s focus on the basics: the game combines the mechanics of map construction, deck building, hero and area control and unique calendar mechanics.
In-Game Layout
What actually happens during the game?
In the base game, you will buy useful artefacts and hire battle units to support your armies, you will build roads and cities and send your heroes to battle - you will have to find the most powerful mixture of all these assets and apply them at the right moment, so you could claim to be the rightful ruler of Battalia and win the game. A victory can be obtained through aggressive conquest or a peaceful development of your own city system (if you are lucky and the others let you ... :) .
The interesting game play will provide you with the opportunity to make key decisions and turn the tides of even the grimmest outcomes. A player can outmaneuver and BE outmaneuvered by his opponents at any point during the game. Dynamic atmosphere and intense battles are key factors in the overall experience, however the game strives to stimulate planning and strategy over rash and impulsive decisions.
In general this is not a luck based game, because of the core deck building mechanics, but a die is integrated as an optional element and is the ingredient, which spices up the game for all the fortunate fellows! You will find also an element of bluffing, when you fight your battles, so put the poker face on and be ready to outsmart your opponent.
The game is defined by the unique combination of mechanics, aesthetic art style, and the presence of large scale 3D Hero figures in four colors, representing the leaders of the players army and their movement on the board.


Game Features:
Basic game mode
Advanced game mode for experienced players
Alternative game scenarios - including completely new game setup for adventurous type of players.
Modular map, built during the game 
Four factions - the Bearfolk, the Cloudborn, the Emberians, the Islanders
Unique calendar mechanics
Unique cards purchase mechanics
Video rules (available at the end of this summer)

What is in the box?
The game contains the following components:
Game board
A special dial, called “The Sun Oracle”
At least 333 cards
A bunch of city tokens - 61 pcs.
8 Miniatures
4 Reference sheets
1 Die - standard D6
And of course - a Rulebook - 12 pages
And here is the components breakdown:
Units are the heart of any players deck. There are four types resp. ranks - Frimen, Chiefs, Priests and Lords. These cards are used for creating new artefacts, building roads or cities and of course for conducting battles.
There are seven types of artefacts, each of them with its own special ability. The players use them for faster development, to upgrade their units, to transform their factions, to travel on the game board, etc. - they will give you a lot of flexibility.
The Great Artefacts are powerful objects crafted in ancient times. Every one of them has its own unique ability and provides big advantages to the player who earned it.
Terrain cards can be cities or roads. They are used for the construction of the map, and.. well - to gain victory points. No matter how strong is your deck, if you don’t have cities, you have nothing!
What we have here is 56 x 56 cm game board, city tokens to mark the level and the owner of the cities, reference sheets to help the players with the different costs in the game and the supply cards which are actually very, very important cards, as they are used for hiring units, building roads, traveling and more. 
Now, let me tell you a few words about the Sun Oracle, shortly called Orac, as it is a key element of the game. The Oracle is almighty ancient monument, eternal apprentice of the nature itself and the hand of the gods among humans and beasts. The Oracle provides advantages to the players and it could support you, if you catch the lucky moment on a sunny day... It counts the days and guides you through the never-ending competition between the folks that inhabit these lands.
Some pictures of the first prototypes and size reference.
The miniatures. There are 8 large scale miniatures which represent the players’ heroes in the game. These figures are the leaders of a player’s armies and mark players’ presence on the game board. Plus - they look amazing!
The factions.
Four factions coexist in the world of Battalia. Most of the cards in the game (units, artefacts and terrain cards) and the 8 figures belong to one of the four factions. A leading concept in the game is that the four factions can freely collaborate with each other, but many units from the same faction, using their own artefacts, are much stronger together. Also, unlike all other games where the players choose their factions, in this game the factions choose the players.
The Cloudborn
The Bearfolk
The Islanders
The Emberians
BATTALIA : The Creation - PDF English rule book - not final, we are still editing spelling & wording!
                                          Like Battalia: The Creation on facebook
    Here the short Introduction from OTSBGR, which came last, but gives a very good quick overview :
You definitely should watch this one! One more long awaited review from Michael Von Kirchmeyer - Off The Shelf Board Game Reviews (Thank You so much Michael, you have really captured the essence of our game, but we are sure that even more surprises are waiting for you, if you play another 3 or 4 rounds :) Big Hug from the whole team !
And now we have finally an actual SAMPLE GAME-PLAY VIDEO from Michael - Off The Shelf Board Game Reviews - this is the SHORT version!
 Here one more video showing Game rules - the LONG version. In part 1 Michael explains all the rules in detail!
Battalia: TC Review from Undead Viking
Battalia: TC preview from Board Game Brawl with Nick Meenachan

* Designer team note: The game material shown in the OTSBGR and Board Game Brawl videos are very early PROTOTYPE - The reviewers got the game a few weeks ago and meanwhile, we've improved a lot the design of the cards and other components like the Oracle and Game Board. The material on the KS site here is the actual one. :) Thanks for watching !

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
On one hand we are just a small company and this is our first Kickstarter project, but on the other we have been publishing board games for the past five years now. We are cooperating with more than 30 famous publishers like FFG, KOSMOS, Hans im Glueck, AMIGO, IELLO and others. During this time we have published Bulgarian localized editions of many worldwide popular board games such as “Game Of Thrones: The Board Game”, “Sid Meier’s Civilization”, “The Legends Of Andor”, “Ubongo”, “Carcassonne”, “Wizard”, “Atlantis”, “ King Of Tokyo”, etc… This means a lot of EXPERIENCE for us! Our production sites are located mainly in Germany, US and China, so international logistics are not an obstacle for us and meanwhile we know very well how to play the “big game” called PUBLISHING.
Please note: the estimated delivery date is mid-November 2015, but please keep in mind that this is only an informed guess. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others. We will do our best to minimize this as much as possible, but if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all we are always ready to refund pledges in full.
Of course, there are risks with every project, but we hope that our track record in publishing and our commitment to do everything as good as possible will gain your trust in us , dear Backer! Battalia: The Creation will be our first own “baby” and we don’t want to do anything wrong after two and a half years of development.
 Production shipping or customs delays are always possible, but since our game is 95% complete, a small delay is probably the worst thing that could occur on this project. The most sophisticated part of our project is probably the production of the Battalia heroes. Yes, exactly – these large and beautiful, but really complicated for production figurines. They are expensive, the process takes a lot of time and commitment, but the result is really worth the effort . To ensure a smooth and accurate production and delivery, we are cooperating with an old partner who is among , the best production factories in Germany - a renown specialist in the board game field with really high quality standards for everything they produce – miniatures, game material, game board, boxes and so on…. This should put everyone's minds at ease, regarding quality and delivery schedule!
We have no reason to expect that something could go terribly wrong, but in case that this happens, please check our refund policy.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, charges included, NO QUESTIONS ASKED. After this period a refund without any explanation is still possible, though that’s minus Kickstarter and Stripe payment processing fees (as we will not be refunded by them after this 60 day period). However, once we’ve begun packaging your rewards for shipment (usually 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), refunds are no longer possible. 
Important: If a game or component cannot be delivered at all (which is very unlikely), at your wish we will refund you the full amount, including fees, or we will try to work with you per e-mail and find a satisfactory solution for your individual case.
Please note: All refunds requested during the original 60 day period are returned to your credit card via Stripe. Refunds requested after this period will be processed via PayPal only!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We want to add a stretch goal for other languages, so we need your support, cause the time is very short and we have other problems to manage right now. We are looking for translators for the following languages* - French, Spanish and German.  
We need a translation of the Rule Book (+Reference sheets) only, since the game is language independent in general. German is the smallest problem actually, since I speak very well German (I lived for 6 years there), but at the moment I have no free time at all, so I would prefer to delegate this task to somebody outside of our team. We have already found somebody for Italian (very experienced gamer and hoby-translator of rule books) and will start in a day or two with this translation.

Greetings Fellows! First of all we want to thank you all from the bottom of our hearts, for the great support and for all comments and advises. After a weekend with so many discussions and controversies we have decided to CANCEL this campaign and to restart in 2 WEEKS, which we need to make all the needed changes and upgrades, to have a really successful relaunch. Our production schedule is very tight, so we can not afford losing more time, since we want to deliver in November (probably many of you want the game before the Christmas holidays)...

@FANTASMAGORIA: That you so much for your extensive and informative replies, especially addressing my and the other backers' questions. I completely understand the importance to maintain game balance and the danger in adding faction and hero powers without proper or adequate play testing. That being said, I am thrilled to hear your plans for an expansion and the addition (optional or not) of asymmetrical faction and hero powers. While I admire the purity of the game in its current state, I believe the addition of such powers will result in the game I am ultimately hoping for. Keep up the great work and we will be here when you relaunch!

Really great info in those last few comments about the game! I totally understand that adding things as a stretchgoal could unbalance the game. I've noticed that some games do kickstarter exclusive sculpted tokens (Blood Rage from CMoN for example) instead of cardboard markers. You could maybe do something like that with the city markers. Other than that I think you have a really good game here so I'll look forward to seeing this project back up. Good luck!

Hell yeah ! The expansion possibilities sounds epic. And being able to play 4-6 players is a big plus. Maybe you should mention a little bit info on this future expansion on the KS relaunch page. It might be intresting to know for new potential backers.
The expansion sounds great, esp. since a maximum of 4 players is always kind of restricted for my gaming group. ;)

I appreciate your response, and do not feel as if you have to explain or cater to me, I like your project as is. It is simply my opinion on the topic at large, and you can heed or ignore it as you will. Keep us posted on the relaunch! ;)

In addition, as much as I love most of what I have seen so far of Battalia, what has given me pause and may have kept some backers away is the apparent lack of faction specific powers. You have these very beautiful (miniatures and artwork) and very thematic elemental factions, but as far as the game play is concerned, they might as well simply be blue, green, red, and yellow factions. I think the fire, water, air, and earth factions need faction specific powers, advantages, and maybe even weaknesses. These can be tied to the heroes (i.e.: each hero can have a unique thematic power, which also helps to differentiate the heroes from each other) and also to some of the cards (for instance, if you play an earth cohort, you activate an additional and different effect from a fire cohort; or an air amulet has a different additional effect from a water amulet; a water weapon gains an additional bonus against a fire hero, etc.). These additional effects can be in the form of optional advanced rules, for those who would prefer a totally symmetric game without thematic effects. I am convinced the inclusion of thematic faction specific effects and/or unique hero powers will attract more backers. Just my two cents. I look forward to your re-launch!

I think optional add-ons could be a great thing even if they don't add that much to the game. Many backers gladly pay more for a game they believe in and they just want a way to give more money if it will help the project reach stretchgoals.

Also doing a sponsored contest on boardgamegeek with the game as a prize would probably generate much traffic. Especially if the questions get people to check out both the kickstarter page and the boardgamegeek page for the game.

I agree with dropping the shirts. In addition to being expensive to fulfill, I find that most kickstarter backers for games prefer to get add-ons that affect either the quality/quantity of received item or items that add to or change gameplay options. So the dice are fine even if some think they are pricey. But additional tiles/cards/figurines would probably also do well, either as duplicates of existing or as a few unique addons.

I hope the project relaunches to great success! I also recommend launching the project with a Kickstarter exclusive/ freebie. I think those Hero Sheers would get people the most excited to pledge. (^_^)
Just a few suggestions from the top of my head :)
And I am sure you made a difficult decision, but I think, it is the right one. Good luck and see you next time (but please keep us updated about the new campaign).

campaign.story:
Greetings, Thank you for taking the time to view my project. I am happy to introduce my hand drawn Mayan inspired custom playing card deck Tzolk'in.
I started this deck with the idea of creating a professional and practical playing card deck that still left room for illustrative creativity. With the addition of Mayan deities as the court cards inspired by the "Dresden Stone" and a set of cards featuring large full bodied pips the Tzolk'in playing card deck was born. Each court card is hand drawn and digitally coloured.
My main goal when creating this playing card deck was to create a deck that was both practical, creative and unique. This deck will be a single print run, so if this project is funded you will have a unique limited edition deck for your collection that you will be able to enjoy for many years to come! 

I hope you will join me in bringing this project to life!
The Playing Card Deck Itself
54 Playing cards, including two jokers, featuring unique hand drawn court cards that are still as practical to play with as any other deck should be 
In standard poker-size of 2.5'' x 3.5'' (63.5mm x 89mm) 
 Printed on 310gsm card 
All playing card boxes will be shrink wrap sealed for that fresh playing card smell :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
For over seven years I designed projects for clients all over the world, from global Corporate Annual Reports to Art Exhibitions for the UN in Geneva, anything you can think of in the design field I have either carried out or been involved in. So rest assured that if you back this project you will only have to sit back and wait until you receive your deck(s) in the post. There are no risks for you to worry about.

campaign.story:
Omnia is the new epic deck from Thirdway Industries, designed by Giovanni Meroni and proudly printed by Expert Playing Cards Co. with Master Finish.
Inspired by ancient symbology and traditional playing cards, drawn with the Thirdway Industries sharp and modern style.
Omnia Rex and Regina Suprema unlocked!
FREE for anyone pledged at least for 3 decks.
Uncut tuckboxes!
Add +25$ to your pledge to get all three! Check this update for details.
 Omnia Brick Box unlocked! Black, heavy paper with foil. It comes free for every brick (not available as add on). Graphics may be changed. If you have limited tiers or bricks you can upgrade your pledge to brick adding a small amount (check the add-ons, below)
Extra cards unlocked! Regina Suicida, Aurea will be added in every Omnia Oscura // Regina Suicida Argentea will be added in every Omnia Illumina. There will be a different, special card for Omnia Suprema (not published yet).
Omnia Pecunia is unlocked as add-on. Add +$14 to your pledge if you want it! You can add as many as you want. See below for details.
Omnia Illumina is unlocked. All the rewards will be splitted. Pledge for at least 2 decks for have it! See below for details.
100% Illustrated courts, aces and jokers
Custom pips
Classic intricate & clean design with perfect symmetry
Metallic inks on cards (a lot!)
Based on classic playing cards
Beautiful queens
Foiled tuck box
Printed by EPCC
There are 3 versions of Omnia:
Omnia Oscura 
Omnia Illumina (stretch goal, unlocked)
Omnia Suprema (Limited Edition, ~ 500 pz)
All version have different tuckboxes, faces and back.
Illumina is unlocked, and all the rewards will be automatically splitted. For example, if you have 6 decks, you'll recieve 3 Oscura and 3 Illumina. If you have an odd number of decks, the unpaired one will be random.
Omnia Oscura - Unlimited
Omnia Oscura uses a deep black box printed with shiny gold foil. Faces uses a lot of gold metallic ink.
Omnia Oscura includes Regina Suicida, Aurea - Suicide Queen with golden Ink background.
Omnia Suprema - Limited Edition
Omnia Suprema is limited to ~ 500 pz, and uses red foil on the tuck box and metallic inks and black background on the faces. There are 525 Omnia Suprema available on Kickstarter and I may print a little more for replacements.
The extra decks (over 500) will be printed only if Suprema is sold out on Kickstarter. If some decks are unsold, I'll put them for sale on my http://www.thirdway.it. website at a very high price. Get them when you can!
Omnia Suprema is available only in special rewards who include 2 or more Omnia "unlimited" decks (Oscura, or, if Illumina is unlocked, split between Oscura + Illumina).
Omnia Illumina
Omnia Illumina uses a bright white box, printed with shiny gold foil. Faces uses a lot of metallic inks, like its black counterpart, but are more bright. Faces are different than Oscura. The backs uses gold metallic ink. 
Omnia Illumina includes Regina Suicida, Argentea - Suicide Queen with golden Ink background, gaff.
The Omnia versions will be dramatically different, not just a simple color swap. Here are some examples:
King of Hearts
Queen of Spades
Jack of Diamonds
Backs
Suprema Queen of Hearts
Ace of Spades of Omnia Oscura and Omnia Suprema (all the Suprema Aces are different, not only the AoS)
 Ace of Hearts
 Omnia Oscura Faces
Those are the faces of Omnia Oscura. The faces of Omnia Suprema and Illumina will be different, and will be revealed during the campaign.
Spades - The rebirth of the universe:
Hearts - War, passion and violence.
Clubs - Goodness and purity
Diamonds - Wealth and power
Jokers - Destiny and Death
Pips are 100% custom, with a subtle gold texture based on the suit's theme.
Brick upgrade
If you have the LIMITED EDITION (3 decks) you can upgrade to brick adding just +$81 (+$97 international). This will add +9 decks (5 Oscura, 4 Illumina) to your pledge.
If you have the DOUBLE LIMITED EDITION (6 decks) you can upgrade to brick adding just +$54 (+$63 international). This will add +6 decks (3 Oscura, 3 Illumina) to your pledge.
If you have a BRICK tier (early brick, brick, early suprema brick or suprema brick) - You can add another brick (6 Oscura, 6 Illumina) with box with just +$100 (+$125 international).
Here is a table:
Omnia Pecunia (Add-On)
Just add +$14 to your pledge if you want it.
It will be 2" - Brass Finish, with a lot of snakes on the front and Lady Fortuna on the back. I may do some changes, this is just a mockup.
I'll start making just 50 coins, and I'll order more if the request will be high. I won't print it again and, as always, the unsold coins will be sold on www.thirdway.it at a higher price. Wooden support not included.
Uncut sheet (Add-On)
Will be shipped unframed and are not signed. Some minor damages on the edges may occur during the transportation (are unavoidable, but can be covered with the frame).
Size: 57.3 x 61.3 cm ( 22.5 x 24.1 inch) - Displays 54 cards
Can be added as add-ons (see below). The price is $30 for US backers, $45 for everyone else. You can choose if you want Omnia Oscura or Omnia Illumina.
You can also purchase a Omnia Suprema Uncut sheet for $60 for US backers and $75 for everyone else. Omnia Suprema Uncut is available only on Kickstarter and will be printed on demand for backers who want one.
How add extra items to your reward
If want to add something to your reward, just edit your pledge and add the amount of the extra items you want indicated in the table below.
Only Omnia Oscura and Illumina are available as add-on decks. Omnia Suprema is available only through the limited tiers.
Giveaway!
We unlocked some free gifts for backers, check the update for more details. Here is the giveaway table:
Stretch goals
$10,000 - Omnia Oscura funded! // REACHED!
$18,000 - Omnia Illumina is unlocked! // REACHED!
$22,000 - Embossing on all decks // REACHED!
$26,000 - Omnia Pecunia unlocked! // REACHED!
$30,000 - Inner FOIL on all decks // REACHED!
$32,000 - Extra card on all decks // REACHED!
$35,000 - Free Box for brick owners //REACHED!
$39,000 - Giveaway! // REACHED!
$52,000 - New Omnia campaign ;)
An explanation on the main theme
The main Omnia theme is cyclicality, especially in the sense of something constantly re-creating itself, the eternal return. The main symbol is the Uroboros, the immortal God-snake who eats its own tail, represents the beginning and the end of time.
There are three different Omnia decks, and every deck represents a dimensional plane in the Omnia Universe. Oscura is the dark side, Illumina the bright one and Suprema is the plane where the Gods live.  
Every court live a different reincarnation in each deck: in Oscura their soul is more dark, they are more malicious, angry or sad. In Illumina they are much more happy, brave and generous. In Suprema they are ascended to Divine, and show their power with elaborate armors, jewels and wings. Think every deck as a different mirror, who reflects every Omnia court with a different soul.
Some symbology
The Ankh was the ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic character that read "life". It represents the concept of eternal life, and the Egyptian Gods are often portrayed carrying it by its loop.
The Ibis was an object of religious veneration in ancient Egypt, particularly associated with the deity Thoth. He is responsible for writing, mathematics, measurement and time as well as the moon and magic.
Anubis is the Greek name of a jackal-headed god associated with mummification and the afterlife in ancient Egyptian religion.
The Philosopher's Stone is a legendary alchemical substance said to be capable of turning base metals such as lead into gold.
Odin is the chief god of the Norse pantheon. He gave one of his eyes for the price of wisdom, and usually disguise himself as an old man. He uses a legendary spear, Gungnir.
Freya is a goddess associated with love, sexuality, beauty, fertility, gold and death. She and Odin are the Omnia Suprema Jokers.
Janus is the god of beginnings and transitions,and thereby of gates, doors, doorways, passages and endings. He is usually depicted as having two faces, since he looks to the future and to the past.
Fortuna was the goddess of fortune and personification of luck in Roman religion. She might bring good luck or bad: she could be represented as veiled and blind, as in modern depictions of Justice, and came to represent life's capriciousness.
 Badges & Goodies
If you are a proud backer of Omnia Playing Cards, you can support the project changing your profile image (Kickstarter or Socials) with our badges. All the courts are included.
I also added some Omnia mobile phones wallpaper (Nexus5, iPhone 5&6). Free, even if you are not a backer! 
UPDATED! Illumina and Suprema phone backgrounds are available!
Download the badges 
Download the backgrounds here
Credits & Notes
Omnia is a Thirdway Industries deck, and will be available on Thirdway Store when the campaign will be over. 
Follow Thirdway Industries on the socials! Contests, offers, fun:
Thirdway Industries Facebook
Thirdway Industries Instagram
Thirdway Industries Twitter
Designed in Italy by Giovanni Meroni. All rights reserved.
Thanks to Bill, Joe, Ivan, Lorenzo, Lotrek, Mike and Pierre for the help and the support :)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed with Expert Playing Cards Co. 
It's a standard procedure and should go smoothly. This is my second Kickstarter and I already worked with EPCC for my Evil Deck and Delirium. 

All the Omnia layouts are approved and ready to be printed when the campaigns ends.

I am located in Italy, and I can't do the fulfillment directly: I'm using a professional fulfillment center. They have already shipped a lot of Kickstarter decks and have a lot of experience in this field.

Of course problems might happen. I can't control other people actions, but I'll follow every step of the process to avoid problems and I will keep everyone updated.

All the elements shown could be changed and improved. Printed colors could be different from the ones you see on your screen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Fuego! Playing Cards is the debut deck of Cellar Window. It will have a limited print run through LPCC (Legends Playing Card Company). These cards are inspired by the works of Mexican political printmaker José Guadalupe Posada and his Calaveras and the Latin phrase "Memento Mori". Each design are all illustrated in-house in a very colorful and detailed style. The tuck case will feature the classic long flap, perforated custom stamp seal, inner calavera motif print and exterior embossing to further accentuate the design and to give added texture.
Fuego! Deck Spades
Fuego! - Luna Deck Spades
Fuego! Deck Hearts
Fuego! - Luna Deck Hearts
Fuego! Deck Clubs
Fuego! - Luna Deck Clubs
Fuego! Deck Diamonds
Fuego! - Luna Deck Diamonds
Fuego! Deck Back Design and Joker Sandwich!
Fuego! Luna Deck Back Design and Joker Sandwich!
Fuego! Deck Custom Pips
The Back Design is given special attention that appeals to talented cardists as well as the avid collector with it's minimalist approach coupled with an intricate touch.
Fuego! Deck Fanned Back Design
Manufacturing and Fulfillment
Fuego! will be manufactured by Legends Playing Card Company on traditionally cut European card stock and Emerald Finish, with precise printing registration making it possible for really thin borders and cards that has a great snap and feel to it. If you have ever handled some of the premium decks from Lawrence at LPPC you will know first hand that their status as one of the top in the playing card manufacturing world is self evident. 
To ensure that your decks arrive safely and quickly, LPCC will also be fulfilling the Fuego! deck. Having manufactured and distributed pledges for countless successful campaigns, no other card company does logistics better than Legends.
Because LPCC is handling the printing and distribution of your playing cards:
Decks are securely packed and safely distributed in a timely manner.
Virtually no additional delays that come from shipping to a different company for distribution after the manufacturing process giving you the backer more peace of mind.
Free Shipping to all parts of the world!
(Left) USPCC & (Right) Precision Cutting by LPCC
Features:
Printed and Fulfilled by the Legends Playing Card Company  
Custom Courts, Aces, Jokers and Pip Layout
Traditionally Cut European Card Stock with Emerald Finish
Premium Matte Card Stock Box
Custom Perforated Tax Stamp Seal
Classic Long Flap
*Interior Print Motif
*Exterior Embossing
*stretch goals
Fuego! Uncut Sheets are the perfect collectors item and undoubtedly a great piece of art to hang on your wall. These will be printed in very limited numbers.
 Straight out of the press that will be printing Fuego, you can get this cool Sol or Luna Uncut Sheets by simply adding $24 to your existing pledge. Only 60 pieces will be available each deck ever! So grab em before they run out and be sure to also message me to reserve your slot for the Uncuts.
Uncut Sheets are 22" x 26.5" "frame not included in both uncut sheets and posters"
Fuego!-Luna Deck is now available for all Backers as an add-on! And the best bit of all, Any Backer that pledged for two or more decks will also be able to have the choice of receiving both decks in their pledge. Making mixed Bricks or Pairs possible.
How to get these awesome Add-ons:
SHOW YOUR BACKER SUPPORT FOR FUEGO! WITH THESE AVATARS!
Please also share this project to your friends if you like it with this link right here! http://bit.ly/fuego-ks
You guys are the ones that can help make this project a reality and into your hands, so the more people who see, like and back this project, the quicker we are able reach our goal and unlock more cool stuff.
Sharing this project on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to your friends is a huge help and is greatly appreciated, thank you so much for being a part of Fuego!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The designs are all set for printing by Legends Playing Cards and they will be handling the manufacturing and fulfillment of the decks, so although there will always be risks to every project we've made an enormous effort to streamline everything and to minimize the challenges for this deck. 

This also gives the opportunity for Fuego! Playing Cards to ship quickly and have no additional shipping fees to Backers. 

And with their amazing track record, we are confident that Legends Playing Cards will do an awesome job with regards to the Printing and Fulfillment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings!

Cabinet of Curiosities
Our new playing card project is now live and you can check it out here!

Hello Everyone,
We will be sending an email with a special link to BackerKit surveys soon. It is important that when you receive the survey, you get it back to us as quickly as you can. Our ability to make an order depends on receiving this information. Filling out your BackerKit survey is not required, but will help out our project tremendously, and help us get your rewards out to you quicker. You do not need to make a login and password to fill out your survey, just fill it out and you’re all good to go! In the BackerKit survey, please answer any questions we may have regarding your pledge, provide shipping information, and if you want you can even order more items or “add-ons”. You do not have access to this link yet, but it will be available soon via email! If you’ve decided later that you filled out something wrong in the survey, you can actually go back and change it anytime before I announce the cut off date for changes. If you use your Facebook login for your Kickstarter account, the BackerKit invite will be sent to the email you used for your Facebook account. If you have another email you prefer it to be sent to, please email support@backerkit.com.

updates.update_userinfo: Our new project is now live!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
We're finally in the home stretch! We're unlocking the Luna upgrades ahead of schedule so now the embossing and inner print will now be featured in all of the Fuego! Luna decks. Now both decks have enough bells and whistles! 
Luna Upgrades

campaign.story:
Thank you everyone! In case you missed out on the campaign, please head to www.steveminty.com to place your pre-orders.
Underworld Deck Unlocked!
Each deck now available as add on for only $13
($15 for International)
FREE ENGRAVED BOX TO BRICK BACKERS
This engraved brick box will now be free to all backers who purchase bricks (12 decks) or more. Only 1 will be limited to each brick backer and each box holds up to 12 decks. These will not be available as an add-on to any other tier. I hope you guys like them!
Olympia Underworld Dies
These dies are available as add-ons for $5
($7 for International)
Olympia Engraved Case
New Reward Add-on! This beautiful wood engraved poker deck case holds 2 signed decks (1 Olympia Deck, 1 Olympia Underworld Deck).
Add a Poker Case for only $100.
($120 for International Orders)
Olympia is an original set of American playing cards designed by Steve Minty and produced by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC). The deck is inspired by the fascinating stories of Greek Gods and their deeds. Olympia blends the classical beauty of Greek Sculptures with the elegant and sleek lines of modern design.
I spent countless hours as a child devouring their stories about love, betrayal, death, vengeance and the heroic deeds within Greek Mythology. I couldn't help but be fascinated by the these stories and it is something that I am very proud of being exposed to.
Hermes as Jack of Spades and Hera as Queen of Spades
My goal when creating the Olympia Deck was to capture the beauty of Greek sculptures in a new medium of playing cards while simultaneously updating it with a graphic twist. I aim to make this deck worthwhile enough to be given as an offering to the altars of the Gods.  
Olympia Deck custom pips and design inspired by dice pips
Back view of the Olympia Tuck
I will be continuing to release more designs and information throughout the project so stay tuned!
OLYMPIA ANTIQUE COPPER CARD
This copper card is personally crafted by me using techniques done by professional jewelers as well a technique I developed through trial and error. It is labor intensive as well as dangerous but it is super cool. I aimed to achieve a look that is weathered and ancient as though it has been around for centuries. Please keep in mind that due to the nature of copper and the process, no card will be alike and appearances will vary. 
You can add one on to your order for just $35! 
($40 for international)
OLYMPIA EXOTIC DEALER BUTTON
This dealer button is engraved from exotic wood and measures approximately 4" x3.5"
You can add-on a dealer button to your order for just $20! 
($22 for International)
OLYMPIA ANTIQUED GOLD FINISH COIN
Example of coins from the Muertos Campaign
Antique Gold 1¾” Engraved Commemorative Coin can be used as a dealer button, card guard, display piece, or decision maker. The front side features the Corinthian Helmet and the back features the Olympia type.
Add an Olympia Coin to any Reward for just $12!
OLYMPIA T-SHIRTS
Black “Olympia” Tshirt for Men & Women (Available in S,M,L,XL, XXL).
 Add an “Olympia" Tshirt to any Reward for just $20!
OLYMPIA BLOOD ORANGE AND BLACK DICE
Add a pair of Blood and Orange dice to any reward for only $5!
($7 for international orders)

OLYMPIA UNCUT SHEET
Each sheet is signed and there will no limit to how many you can add. Measures approx 22" by 26 1/2" Shipped seperately in a 25"x3" tube
Add an Olympia Uncut Sheet to any reward for $40.  
($65 for international orders)
HOW TO GET YOUR SWEET SWEET ADD-ONS:
1. After you have pledged to the project there will be a blue Manage your pledge button on the right hand column as seen above.  
2. Increase your pledge in the Pledge Amount box by the total of the add-ons you want to add. Unless you want to change your tier at the same time, Do not change the tier you are currently pledged at. If you do change your tier, just add the total of add-ons to your new tier level. (If you are an international backer, please be sure to pledge the international amount)
3. You then have to confirm your new pledge amount and will be sent to Amazon for checkout completion!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This campaign will be my second after the first highly successful Muertos Campaign. Although there were some technical difficulties with the one of the printers and other issue, I've taken what I've learned from that experience and will apply a more efficient yet effective process to allow for another successful campaign. As always, I have done a lot of research and followed up on a lot of companies to ensure that this project goes as smoothly as possible. There may be the risks of the unforeseen but I have prepared myself enough with knowledge and research to minimize it if necessary. I listed the delivery date conservatively in order to not rush the production of the product. As a designer and consumer, I know that it is necessary to have a high-end product and I am committed to delivering the best product possible.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello Everyone! Thank you for your input on what to name the upcoming decks. After much debating, I have decided on what to name the decks.

Without much further ado, I present:

The Anubis and Osiris Deck now live on Kickstarter!

Hello Everyone!

Hope you're having a great holidays thus far. I just wanted to let you know that I will be observing the holidays (today and tomorrow) so shipping will be briefly paused and resume thereafter. Most of the shipments have been made but there are still more to go so if you haven't received an e-mail, no worries, yours will be shipped out very soon! It is just me shipping them out so I thank you for your endless patience!

I hope you are having a great time and please look forward to the good news when shipping has been completed and the new project launched!

campaign.story:
Name of the deck was inspired by Branle, 12th-century French chain dance adopted (c. 1450–c. 1650) by European aristocrats, especially in France and in England, where the word branle was anglicized as “brawl.” 
Aristocrats frequently performed pantomimic branles in which they scolded each other like washerwomen or courted (as in the branle de Poitou, the possible ancestor of the minuet). Certain branles, especially in France, were designated for specific age groups, such as the lively branle de Bourgogne for the youngest dancers.
 Branle Playing Cards on Kardify (first look): http://goo.gl/GON17H
UnitedCardists: http://goo.gl/tNPPMI
MaxPlayingCards: http://goo.gl/1KyyGJ
ICollectPlayingCards: http://goo.gl/jEHQru
Branle Playing Cards deck portrays history and culture of 16-17 centuries. Each of the suits can be associated with a particular European country. For example, the peaks - Britain, hearts - France, clubs - Spain and diamonds - Eastern Europe (Rzeczpospolita, Transylvania, Hungary). Suits are not linked to these countries directly, but the association is undoubtedly present. It is more like an alternative view to the real European history and culture of that era.
Only 800 decks will be ever printed and will be limited for Kickstarter backers only. Each deck will have numbered custom seal.
 All artwork created by Chesley Trem.
Hearts
Diamonds
Clubs
Spades
Jokers and back
Numbered cards

Detailed Box
 Interior print of box
Option #1 (vote in update #2)
Option #2 (vote in update #2)
Please share this project around and let it see the world, that’s the only way we can make this project succeed. You can share this project on facebook or tweet it, just click button under project main image on top.
We want to make our backers happy, so message us on any questions. We are open to your thoughts regarding this project.
Printed and Fulfilled by the NPCC 
Only 800 decks will be printed (750 available on KS)
Custom Courts, Aces, Jokers, Pips Layout, Backside and Tuck box
Casino Classic Black Core Card stock with Linen Finish
Premium Card Stock Box
Custom Numbered Seals
Custom Interior as goal
Exterior Embossing as goal
Hot Foil Stamping as goal

campaign.story:
Satire bodes poorly in text, it has long been said.
So, a cleverly-dealt jab is best drawn as a likeness instead!
Meet ROYAL PULP, the subversive new deck from Gambler's Warehouse.
Deep mineral blues and vintage blood-tones saturate a marble-cream-parchment backdrop, while comic court characters pose pompously for portraits, utterly betrayed.
Featuring artwork from Brad Foster and Blackout Brother, ROYAL PULP goes to print in Summer, 2015. Printing will be through either EPCC or USPCC based on the project's success.
Back this project at just $16 (Early Bird Pricing) to receive one-EACH of the color-themed decks! 
Royal Pulp v.1
 Royal Pulp v.2
Embossed Card Sets
These limited edition sets, printed by MPC, will feature embossing on both the tuck box AND the cards! Only 250 sets will be available and they will come with numbered seals. 
1 set per backer. You must send us a PM to confirm your reservation.
Pricing per set is as follows:
$35 US / $40 Canada / $42 rest of world
Simply add this amount on to your existing pledge and then send us a PM to confirm your reservation.
Uncut Sheets:
Easily Add On Decks!
